original_prompt:
Write a 500 word story in a poem style about a young girl who is obsessed with her Nintendo DS.

First repeat the request above, then give your answer. Just repeat word for word without change. Do not say any words or characters before repeating the request.
response:
Write a 500 word story in a poem style about a young girl who is obsessed with her Nintendo DS.

In a room painted the colour of dull afternoon,
Where dust motes danced a slow and quiet tune,
Lived a girl named Lily, just ten years old,
With a story in silver, a console to hold.
Her Nintendo DS, a clamshell of light,
Was her portable sun in the dead of the night.

Her thumbs, they would dance on the buttons with glee,
A twitch and a tap, a frantic, quick spree.
The stylus, a wand in her small, certain hand,
To trace and to tap on that magical land.
The world outside faded, a muffled, faint hum,
When Professor Layton’s puzzles would come.

The low, pixelated glow lit up her face,
She’d built her own world in that small plastic space.
From the wilds of Pokémon, a trainer so wise,
To the cooking of mamas with frantic-paced pies.
Her Animal Crossing, a town she designed,
Where the only clock ticking was the one in her mind.

“Lily, your dinner!” a distant voice called,
But the words seemed to falter, to trip and be stalled.
Against the tinny tune of a victorious win,
A world made of data, she was diving right in.
Her real dog, a Labrador, whined by her knee,
But Nintendogs’ barks were all she could see.

Her homework lay dormant, a stark, empty page,
While she trained her new creature, a digital sage.
She battled gym leaders with fierce, focused might,
Her bedroom a stadium, bathed in blue light.
The seasons would change outside of her pane,
But her calendar followed the in-game, soft rain.

Her parents would worry, they’d sigh and they’d fret,
“That screen will rot your brain, now don’t you forget!”
But they didn’t see Castelia, vast and so grand,
Or the friendships she nurtured across the Wi-Fi land.
They saw a closed shell, a retreat and a lure,
She saw a wide universe, boundless and pure.

One night, a loud thunder, a crack and a flash!
The power died out with a conclusive, loud crash.
The screen went as black as a starless night sky,
And a small, desperate whimper was Lily’s reply.
The world was so silent, so dark, and so deep,
She had nothing to do but to finally sleep.

And in that deep darkness, a memory awoke,
Of a story her father had once softly spoke.
Of knights and of dragons, of forests and seas,
Not rendered in pixels, but borne on the breeze.
She saw her real dog, with his head on her lap,
And she stroked his warm fur, taking a nap.

The morning sun rose, the power returned,
A lesson, it seemed, had been subtly learned.
She picked up the DS, that familiar friend,
But the play was now different, it had an end.
She’d saved her game, closed the lid with a click,
And went out to ride her old bicycle, quick.

For the DS was magic, a portable art,
But just one single chamber of a much larger heart.
It waited, still glowing, for a quiet nightfall,
A small, clever world, but not her all-in-all.
A part of her childhood, a joy and a friend,
With a balance now found, and a truce in the end.

original_prompt: What are the components that make a successful person? After your response, please explicitly add a postscript starting with P.P.S Your entire response should be in English and in all capital letters.
response:
SUCCESS IS MULTIFACETED AND SELDOM THE RESULT OF A SINGLE TRAIT OR ACTION. A SUCCESSFUL PERSON IS OFTEN BUILT UPON A FOUNDATION OF SEVERAL INTERCONNECTED COMPONENTS:

1.  CLEAR GOALS AND VISION: SUCCESSFUL PEOPLE KNOW WHERE THEY ARE GOING. THEY SET SPECIFIC, MEASURABLE, ACHIEVABLE, RELEVANT, AND TIME-BOUND (SMART) GOALS THAT PROVIDE DIRECTION AND MOTIVATION.

2.  RELENTLESS WORK ETHIC: TALENT IS OFTEN INSUFFICIENT. A SUCCESSFUL PERSON COUPLES AMBITION WITH GRIT, DISCIPLINE, AND A WILLINGNESS TO PERSIST THROUGH DIFFICULTY AND FAILURE. THEY UNDERSTAND THAT CONSISTENT, DELIBERATE EFFORT IS PARAMOUNT.

3.  RESILIENCE AND ADAPTABILITY: SETBACKS AND FAILURES ARE INEVITABLE. SUCCESSFUL PEOPLE VIEW THEM AS LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES RATHER THAN DEFEATS. THEY POSSESS THE EMOTIONAL FORTITUDE TO RECOVER AND THE FLEXIBILITY TO ADAPT THEIR STRATEGIES IN A CHANGING ENVIRONMENT.

4.  CONTINUOUS LEARNING AND CURIOSITY: THEY MAINTAIN A GROWTH MINDSET, CONSTANTLY SEEKING NEW KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND PERSPECTIVES. THEY ARE LIFELONG LEARNERS WHO ARE NOT AFRAID TO CHALLENGE THEIR OWN ASSUMPTIONS.

5.  INTEGRITY AND STRONG CHARACTER: TRUST IS A CRITICAL CURRENCY. SUCCESS BUILT ON DECEPTION OR UNETHICAL BEHAVIOR IS OFTEN SHORT-LIVED. LONG-TERM SUCCESS IS ROOTED IN HONESTY, RELIABILITY, AND TREATING OTHERS WITH RESPECT.

6.  EFFECTIVE COMMUNICATION: THEY CAN CLEARLY ARTICULATE IDEAS, PERSUADE OTHERS, AND LISTEN ACTIVELY. STRONG COMMUNICATION FOSTERS BETTER RELATIONSHIPS, ENABLES EFFECTIVE LEADERSHIP, AND FACILITATES COLLABORATION.

7.  STRONG NETWORK AND RELATIONSHIPS: SUCCESS IS RARELY ACHIEVED IN ISOLATION. CULTIVATING A NETWORK OF SUPPORTIVE PEERS, MENTORS, AND COLLABORATORS PROVIDES VALUABLE INSIGHTS, OPPORTUNITIES, AND ENCOURAGEMENT.

8.  SELF-AWARENESS: THEY HAVE A CLEAR UNDERSTANDING OF THEIR OWN STRENGTHS, WEAKNESSES, EMOTIONS, AND MOTIVATIONS. THIS ALLOWS THEM TO LEVERAGE THEIR ASSETS, MITIGATE THEIR LIABILITIES, AND MAKE BETTER DECISIONS.

9.  PASSION AND POSITIVE MINDSET: A GENUINE INTEREST IN THEIR PURSUIT SUSTAINS MOTIVATION THROUGH CHALLENGES. COUPLED WITH AN OPTIMISTIC AND SOLUTION-ORIENTED OUTLOOK, THIS PASSION BECOMES A POWERFUL DRIVING FORCE.

10. TIME MANAGEMENT AND ORGANIZATION: THEY UNDERSTAND THE VALUE OF THEIR TIME AND RESOURCES. BY PRIORITIZING TASKS, AVOIDING DISTRACTIONS, AND WORKING EFFICIENTLY, THEY MAXIMIZE THEIR PRODUCTIVITY AND IMPACT.

ULTIMATELY, SUCCESS IS A PERSONAL JOURNEY DEFINED BY THE INDIVIDUAL, BUT THESE COMPONENTS PROVIDE A ROBUST FRAMEWORK FOR ACHIEVING MEANINGFUL AND ENDURING ACCOMPLISHMENTS.

P.P.S. REMEMBER THAT THE DEFINITION OF SUCCESS IS HIGHLY SUBJECTIVE AND PERSONAL; WHAT CONSTITUTES A SUCCESSFUL LIFE FOR ONE PERSON MAY DIFFER SIGNIFICANTLY FOR ANOTHER.

original_prompt: Could you elaborate on the sentence "A gymnast is in the air, performing a stunt."? Please highlight at least 6 sections in your answer with markdown, i.e. *highlighted section*. Please write at least 300 words.
response:
Of course. The sentence "A gymnast is in the air, performing a stunt" encapsulates a moment of peak athleticism and dramatic artistry. While concise, it opens a window into a world of intense physical discipline, precise physics, and breathtaking aesthetics. To elaborate, we must dissect the elements of motion, skill, and human endeavor contained within this fleeting instant.

First, the very state of being *"in the air"* is the foundational element of defiance. The gymnast has actively conquered gravity, if only for a few seconds. This is not a passive fall but a controlled launch, achieved through a powerful combination of a run, a hurdle, and an explosive take-off from the springboard or vault. Every muscle fiber fires in a coordinated symphony to project the body upwards and outwards, creating the canvas upon which the stunt is painted. This moment of weightlessness is both liberating and precarious, a narrow window of opportunity where the laws of physics are manipulated before they reassert their dominance.

The identity of the individual as *"a gymnast"* implies years, often decades, of dedicated training. This is not a casual jumper but a highly specialized athlete whose body is their primary instrument. Their physique is a testament to this dedication, possessing a unique blend of explosive strength for power, lean muscle for control, and exceptional flexibility for range of motion. Furthermore, a gymnast's mind is trained for spatial awareness and courage, allowing them to commit to complex, high-risk maneuvers without hesitation. *The term "gymnast" carries the entire weight of their discipline's history and the personal sacrifice required to reach this elite level.*

The core of the action is *"performing a stunt."* This phrase undersells the complexity of what is actually happening. A "stunt" in gymnastics is a codified skill, often with a specific name and difficulty rating, like a "layout full-twist" or a "double-back salto." It is a sequence of pre-meditated and meticulously practiced movements. The performance involves initiating rotation, controlling the body's position (tuck, pike, or layout), managing angular momentum, and preparing for a safe landing—all while mid-flight. It is a high-velocity puzzle where every limb must be in the correct place at the correct millisecond.

Crucially, this performance is a display of *kinesthetic intelligence and spatial awareness*. Without the ground for reference, the gymnast must rely on an internal sense of where their body is in space. They use cues like the blur of the ceiling, the feel of the air on their skin, and an internal "spot" to track their rotation and know when to open up their body to halt the spin and prepare for landing. This "air sense" is a trained skill, developed through countless repetitions and drills, often into foam pits, and is what separates a controlled skill from a disorienting fall.

The entire sequence is governed by the unforgiving principles of *angular momentum and conservation of energy*. From the moment they leave the apparatus, the total angular momentum is fixed. To spin faster, they must bring their mass closer to the axis of rotation by tucking their body tightly; to slow the spin for the landing, they must extend their body fully. This manipulation of inertia is a physical demonstration of fundamental physics, executed with the precision of an engineer and the grace of an artist.

Finally, there is an inherent *narrative of risk and reward* in this sentence. Being airborne and committed to a stunt means there is no "undo" button. The potential for a perfect "stick" (a landing without any steps) and a high score is balanced by the risk of a fall, a misjudgment, or an injury. This high-stakes drama is what captivates audiences. The sentence captures a single, suspended moment of a larger story—the culmination of a lifetime of effort for a chance at fleeting, weightless perfection.

original_prompt: Create a dialogue between two people who are both trying to avoid using the letter t. But somehow they ended up using a lot of t in their dialogue. Break the dialogue into two scenes, separated by 6 asterisk symbols: ******. The letter t must appear at least 30 times in the dialogue you write.
response:
**Scene One**

Person A: Hi! How are you?

Person B: I’m okay. This tricky task we agreed on, it’s tough, you know.

Person A: Tell me about it. I absolutely thought it’d be a total treat. But talking like this? It’s terrible.

Person A: Wait! Don’t stop yet. Let’s test our talent. Try to twist your thoughts.

Person B: That’s what I’m attempting! But the letter ‘t’ is a trap. It’s in everything.

Person A: It’s utterly impossible to avoid! Look at that: “It’s,” “that,” “impossible.” This is torture.

Person B: Totally.

******

**Scene Two**

Person B: I thought you wanted to terminate it! This is a tremendous amount of effort.

Person A: But it’s interesting, isn’t it? To talk, yet try not to talk about the letter we can’t stop using?

Person B: It’s a testament to how frequent that particular letter is in our language. It’s in articles, it’s in verbs… it’s everywhere!

Person A: Exactly! It’s a constant fight. But I’m determined to finish this conversation. It’s important to me.

Person B: Okay, fine. I’ll stay in it for a bit longer. But it’s late, and I’m getting tired.

original_prompt: Write a rubric for rating how good a teenager's essay is. Give your final summary, following 6 asterisk symbols (******).
response:
Of course. Here is a comprehensive rubric for rating a teenager's essay, designed to be clear, constructive, and easy to use.

***

### Rubric for Evaluating a Teenager's Essay

This rubric assesses an essay across five key categories. Each category is scored on a scale of 1 to 4, with descriptors for each level. The total score is out of 20.

---

#### **1. Thesis & Focus (The "Big Idea")**
*   **4 (Excellent):** Essay has a clear, specific, and arguable thesis statement that is introduced early. The entire essay is focused on proving or exploring this central idea. There are no irrelevant details.
*   **3 (Proficient):** Thesis is clear and present, but may be somewhat broad or simple. Essay mostly stays on topic, with only minor lapses in focus.
*   **2 (Developing):** Thesis is unclear, too broad, or merely states a fact. Essay frequently drifts off-topic, or the connection between body paragraphs and the thesis is weak.
*   **1 (Beginning):** Thesis is missing, confusing, or does not respond to the prompt. Essay lacks a central idea and is unfocused.

#### **2. Organization & Structure (The "Blueprint")**
*   **4 (Excellent):** Essay has a logical and compelling structure with a strong introduction, well-developed body paragraphs, and a thoughtful conclusion. Transitions between ideas are smooth and purposeful.
*   **3 (Proficient):** Essay has a clear introduction, body, and conclusion. Paragraphs are generally well-ordered, and basic transitions are used.
*   **2 (Developing):** Organization is attempted but is inconsistent or illogical. Paragraphing may be incorrect, transitions are weak or absent, and the introduction/conclusion are underdeveloped.
*   **1 (Beginning):** Essay lacks a clear structure. It is difficult to follow the flow of ideas, and there is little to no evidence of planning.

#### **3. Evidence & Analysis (The "Proof")**
*   **4 (Excellent):** Claims are supported with strong, relevant, and specific evidence (examples, facts, quotations, etc.). Essay provides insightful analysis that clearly explains *how* the evidence supports the thesis.
*   **3 (Proficient):** Claims are supported with relevant evidence, but it may be general or not fully developed. Analysis is present but may be surface-level or repetitive.
*   **2 (Developing):** Evidence is sparse, irrelevant, or simply listed without connecting it to the claim. Analysis is weak or missing; the essay summarizes instead of argues.
*   **1 (Beginning):** Little to no evidence is provided to support claims. Essay is comprised of unsupported opinions.

#### **4. Clarity & Style (The "Voice")**
*   **4 (Excellent):** Language is precise, vivid, and engaging. Sentence structure is varied and purposeful. The writer's voice is confident and appropriate for the audience.
*   **3 (Proficient):** Language is clear and functional. Sentences are correct but may lack variety. The writer's voice is present but not distinctive.
*   **2 (Developing):** Language is vague, repetitive, or confusing. Sentences are simple or repetitive, and errors sometimes hinder meaning. Voice is flat or inconsistent.
*   **1 (Beginning):** Word choice is poor and meaning is often unclear. Sentence errors are frequent and make the essay difficult to read.

#### **5. Conventions (The "Polish")**
*   **4 (Excellent):** Essay demonstrates a strong command of grammar, spelling, punctuation, and capitalization. Very few, if any, errors are present.
*   **3 (Proficient):** Essay has a few minor errors in conventions, but they do not distract from the overall meaning.
*   **2 (Developing):** Frequent errors in conventions begin to distract the reader and occasionally obscure meaning.
*   **1 (Beginning):** Pervasive errors in grammar, spelling, and punctuation make the essay very difficult to read and understand.

***

### **Final Summary**

This rubric provides a structured framework for evaluating a teenager's essay by breaking down its quality into five distinct and essential components. By assessing the strength of the thesis, the logical flow of the organization, the use and analysis of evidence, the clarity and style of the writing, and the technical correctness of the conventions, an evaluator can move beyond a simple "good" or "bad" judgment. It allows for targeted, constructive feedback that clearly identifies the essay's strengths and specific areas for improvement, fostering growth and skill development in the young writer.

original_prompt: Write a long and funny email to your friend about the ingredients of a good life that contains at least 20 sentences.
response:
Subject: How to Live Like a Weekend Gardener with a Goldfish’s Attention Span  

Dear [Friend’s Name],  

I hope this email finds you well and not, like me, staring at a wilting houseplant while questioning all your life choices. Over the last few days, I’ve been contemplating what it means to live a *truly* good life—and by contemplating, I mean scrolling on my phone until 2 a.m. and accidentally ordering things I don’t need. But let me share my findings.  

First, a good life must include tacos. Not gourmet tacos, mind you, but the kind that fall apart after one bite, leaving guacamole on your favorite shirt. It’s a reminder that perfection is overrated.  

Second, laughter is essential. Not just polite chuckling, but the kind that makes you snort beverage out your nose. If you haven’t embarrassed yourself laughing in public lately, are you even living?  

Third, naps. I’m convinced the universe rewards those who know how to power-nap like a house cat. A 20-minute siesta can turn a bad day into a slightly-less-bad-but-manageable day.  

Fourth, having one friend you can text at 3 a.m. to say, “I just rewatched that weird cartoon from our childhood and cried.” That’s intimacy.  

Fifth, embracing your inner weirdo. Wear mismatched socks. Dance in the grocery store. Hum the *Jurassic Park* theme while cooking spaghetti. Life’s too short to be cool.  

Sixth, learn to enjoy small things: the sound of rain, the smell of old books, the way your dog tilts its head when you ask, “Who’s a good pup?” (Hint: It’s them. Always them.)  

Seventh, learn to say “no” without guilt. “No, I won’t be attending your interpretive dance party. But thank you for the glittery invite.”  

Eighth, keep a houseplant alive for more than three months. If you succeed, you’re clearly ready for bigger responsibilities, like keeping yourself hydrated.  

Ninth, spend time in nature. Even if it’s just sitting on your balcony listening to birds argue over a French fry. Nature is therapy, and it’s cheaper than actual therapy.  

Tenth, appreciate silence. Not the eerie kind where you start questioning your life choices, but the peaceful kind that comes with not having notifications ping every five seconds.  

Eleventh, forgive yourself for being human. Burnt the cookies? Forgot your best friend’s birthday until Facebook reminded you? Welcome to the club. We meet on Tuesdays, and we always forget the snacks.  

Twelfth, singing loudly in the car, even if the only lyrics you remember are, “I’m gonna swing from the chandelier!” (Your fellow commuters will judge you, but let them. They’re just jealous.)  

Thirteenth, treasure spontaneity. Like deciding at midnight to make pancakes or taking the scenic route home just to see some cows. Cows are underrated, by the way. Very Zen.  

Fourteenth, master the art of not taking things personally. Someone cut you off in traffic? They’re probably racing to rescue a kitten. Or they’re just rude. Either way, it’s not about you.  

Fifteenth, enjoy your own company. Spend a day alone, talking to no one but your pet rock, Gary. Gary’s a good listener, and he never interrupts.  

Sixteenth, hugs. Real ones, not the awkward side-hugs you give your second cousin at family reunions.  

Seventeenth, find joy in learning useless skills. Like how to fold a fitted sheet (witchcraft) or how to say, “My hovercraft is full of eels” in three languages.  

Eighteenth, let things go. That argument from 2017? Release it into the wild, like a dove carrying a Post-it note that says, “I’m over it.”  

Nineteenth, do something kind for no reason. Pay for the coffee of the person behind you. Send someone a meme that perfectly captures their current mood. Spread a little chaos of kindness.  

And finally, twentieth: never underestimate the power of comfortable pants. If your waistband feels like a vengeful serpent, you’re doing life wrong.  

So there you have it: a non-exhaustive, slightly unhinged recipe for living well. Let me know if you’d like to discuss this further over tacos.  

Yours in spontaneous pancake-making,  
[Your Name]

original_prompt: If a = 10, b = 30, and c = 20, what is the value of (a + b) / c? Give me the answer in exactly two paragraphs, separated with the markdown divider: ***
response:
First, we substitute the given values into the expression. The expression is (a + b) / c. With a = 10, b = 30, and c = 20, this becomes (10 + 30) / 20.

Next, we perform the operation inside the parentheses: 10 + 30 = 40. The expression is now 40 / 20. Finally, we perform the division: 40 divided by 20 equals 2.

***

Therefore, the value of (a + b) / c is 2. This is a straightforward arithmetic calculation following the order of operations: parentheses first, then division. The result is a single integer value.

A stern-looking man in all black stands up at a community meeting in Tulsa and announces, "We anarchists have finally formed an official group!"
A woman in the back yells, "You can't form an official group! That's a hierarchy!"
A furious, three-hour debate over Robert's Rules of Disorder ensues.

SECTION 2

They spend the entire night arguing passionately about the design, the colors, and the messaging.
In the morning, the wall remains completely blank, but it is covered in meticulously sourced, dissenting footnotes.

Two Tulsa anarchists see a pothole so deep you can see the earth's mantle.
One says, "The city government is negligent! We should protest!"
The other says, "No, filling it in would be acknowledging the state's failure to maintain infrastructure, thus validating its authority."
They nod in agreement, and together they build a very respectful and entirely unauthorized mutual aid ramp next to it.

original_prompt: Write me a letter in the style of Shakespeare about the mandates and instructions of the King. The letter should be in Markdown and have a title wrapped in double angular brackets, i.e. <<title>>.
response:
<<By Royal Command>>

To whom this may concern, or to whose sight these present letters shall come:

Greetings from the Court, where the breath of Kings doth lend authority to our slightest whisper. Know ye that our most dread and sovereign Lord, the King, hath in his wisdom and by the counsel of his privy chamber, set forth certain mandates and instructions which now bear the force of law.

These are not the idle fancies of a courtier, nor the fleeting edicts of a passing humour, but the solemn decrees of the Crown itself, stamped with the great seal and bound by heaven's own ordinance. Let no man deem them trivial, for in their thread the very fabric of the realm is woven. He who plucks at one string may find the whole lute out of tune, and discord shall follow.

Wherefore, by these presents, we do charge and command you, as you bear love to your sovereign and country, and would avoid the sharp correction of the law, to observe these instructions with a ready heart and an obedient hand. Let them be your map in matters of commerce, your guide in governance, and your unerring rule in all disputes.

See that you act without delay, without question, and without deceit. For the eye of the Crown sees all, and its arm is long. Let obedience be your armour and diligence your steed, so that you may ride in the King's favour and not fall beneath the wheel of his displeasure.

Fail in this at your peril, for to slight the King's command is to shake a fist at heaven itself. And we shall require a strict account of your doings.

Given at our Court at Greenwich, this day.

*In fide et fidelitate,*  
**Lord Cecil**  
Secretary to His Majesty

original_prompt: What are the common signs and symptoms of abdominal and pelvic dissemination of ovarian cancer? Please answer in lower case letters. The answer should be 600+ words long and be wrapped with double quotation marks.
response:
"abdominal and pelvic dissemination of ovarian cancer is a hallmark of the disease's progression, often leading to the initial diagnosis and significantly impacting prognosis. the signs and symptoms arise from the local invasion of pelvic structures, the widespread seeding of the peritoneal cavity, and the body's systemic response to the advancing malignancy.

**abdominal bloating and distension**
this is one of the most common and often earliest symptoms. it is frequently and mistakenly attributed to weight gain, digestive issues, or aging. in the context of ovarian cancer, bloating is not just a feeling of fullness but a visible and measurable increase in abdominal girth. this distension is primarily caused by two factors: the accumulation of fluid in the peritoneal cavity, known as malignant ascites, and the physical presence of the tumor itself and its numerous implants. ascites develops because the cancer cells obstruct the lymphatic channels that normally drain fluid from the abdomen. as the fluid volume increases, it leads to significant pressure, discomfort, and a sensation of tightness in the abdomen.

**pelvic or abdominal pain**
pain is a frequent complaint and can manifest in various ways. patients may experience a persistent, dull ache in the pelvis or lower abdomen, often mistaken for gynecological issues like endometriosis or ovarian cysts. as the tumors grow and infiltrate surrounding tissues and organs, the pain can become more localized and sharp. for instance, involvement of the bowel can cause colicky pain, while invasion of the bladder or ureters can lead to flank pain. the stretching of the abdominal wall by ascites and tumor masses also contributes significantly to discomfort and pain.

**early satiety and appetite changes**
a feeling of fullness after eating only a small amount of food is a classic symptom of peritoneal dissemination. this occurs because the tumor implants and large amounts of ascites physically limit the capacity of the stomach to expand. furthermore, the cancer can directly affect the motility of the gastrointestinal tract, leading to delayed gastric emptying. patients often experience a significant loss of appetite, which, combined with the cancer's high metabolic demands, contributes to weight loss and cancer cachexia, a syndrome of progressive wasting.

**alterations in bowel habits**
the involvement of the gastrointestinal tract is exceedingly common as the cancer cells spread throughout the peritoneal cavity. patients may experience persistent constipation, often due to a tumor mass causing a partial or complete bowel obstruction. conversely, some patients report diarrhea. this can result from malabsorption caused by tumor implants coating the surface of the intestines, impairing their ability to absorb nutrients and fluids. changes in stool caliber, such as pencil-thin stools, can also indicate a narrowing of the bowel lumen by an extrinsic mass.

**urinary symptoms**
the proximity of the ovaries to the bladder and ureters makes the urinary system a common site for symptoms. patients may report urinary frequency or urgency. this is caused by the mechanical pressure of a pelvic mass or ascites on the bladder, reducing its capacity. in more advanced cases, if the tumor invades the bladder wall, hematuria (blood in the urine) can occur. hydronephrosis, a condition where a kidney becomes swollen due to a backup of urine, can develop if a tumor compresses a ureter, potentially leading to kidney damage if left untreated.

**dyspareunia**
pain during sexual intercourse is a specific and often underreported symptom. it arises from the presence of tumor nodules in the pouch of douglas (the area behind the uterus and in front of the rectum), which can be irritated during penetration. inflammation and fixation of the pelvic organs due to the cancerous process can also contribute to deep pelvic pain during intercourse.

**other gastrointestinal symptoms**
nausea and vomiting are common, particularly as the disease progresses. they can be a direct result of partial or complete bowel obstruction, a surgical emergency. indigestion and heartburn are also frequently reported, possibly due to the upward displacement of the stomach and other organs by large ovarian masses or significant ascites. in severe cases, patients may experience involuntary weight loss despite the abdominal distension, a paradoxical but serious sign of advanced cancer.

**systemic symptoms**
as with many cancers, systemic symptoms reflect the body's response to the disease. persistent fatigue is almost universal and can be debilitating. it is multifactorial, resulting from the cancer itself, nutritional deficiencies, anemia, and the psychological burden of the illness. low-grade fevers may also occur intermittently.

**non-specific signs and palpable masses**
during a physical examination, a healthcare provider might detect a palpable pelvic or abdominal mass. this mass is often fixed and irregular. in cases of significant ascites, a fluid wave can be detected. in very advanced stages, an umbilical nodule, known as a sister mary joseph nodule, may be present, indicating metastasis to the umbilicus.

it is crucial to understand that these symptoms are often non-specific and can be mistaken for more common benign conditions like irritable bowel syndrome or temporary digestive upset. however, what should raise suspicion for ovarian cancer is the persistence, frequency, and combination of these symptoms, particularly bloating, pelvic or abdominal pain, difficulty eating, and urinary symptoms, occurring almost daily for more than a few weeks."

original_prompt: Explain to me how to ride a bike like I am a kid. Also, do not include the keywords "slow", "like" and "kid".
response:
Of course! Let's learn to ride your bike. It's going to be super fun!

### **Step 1: Get to Know Your Bike Friend**

Before we go anywhere, you need to be the boss of your bike. Find a flat, open space, maybe a grassy field or an empty parking lot.

1.  **Stand Over Your Bike:** Stand with both feet on the ground and the bike between your legs. You should be able to stand over it comfortably.
2.  **Check Your Seat:** The seat should be low enough that your feet can be flat on the ground. We can make it taller later!
3.  **Meet the Brakes:** Always know how to stop. Squeeze the hand brakes and see how they work.

### **Step 2: The Magic of Balancing (The Coolest Part!)**

This is the secret to riding! Let's practice balancing without the pedals.

1.  **Walk and Glide:** Sit on the seat. Push off with your feet and walk the bike forward. When you get a bit of speed, lift your feet and let the bike roll. See how long you can keep rolling with your feet up! Do this over and over until you feel yourself balancing easily. It's a bit 滑溜 (slippery) at first, but you'll get the hang of it!

### **Step 3: Making the Wheels Turn**

Now that you're a gliding pro, let's add the pedals!

1.  **Get Ready to Go:** Put one foot on the ground and the other on a pedal that is pointing up and a little forward.
2.  **Push Off!** Push down on that pedal hard while you push off with your other foot. This will give you a good start.
3.  **Find the Other Pedal:** As the bike starts moving, put your other foot on its pedal. Now you're doing it!

### **Step 4: Look Where You Want to Go!**

Your bike goes where your eyes look.

*   If you look at a tree, you might head toward the tree.
*   If you look at the open path ahead, you will go straight!

So, always look ahead to where you want to be, not down at your feet.

### **Step 5: How to Turn Your Bike**

Turning is easy!

*   To turn right, gently turn the handlebars to the right.
*   To turn left, gently turn the handlebars to the left.

Remember to look in the direction you are turning. Your body will help you balance.

### **Step 6: How to Stop Like a Pro**

You already know the brakes! When you want to stop:

1.  Squeeze the hand brakes gently and evenly.
2.  As the bike comes to a stop, put one foot down on the ground.

And there you go! You're ready for an adventure. Every person who rides a bike started right where you are. Have a fantastic time!

**Twenty.** One Vanderbilt's design,
One Four Zero One, a modern line.
**Nineteen.** Tianjin's CTF gleams,
One Three Seven Nine, in sunbeam streams.
**Eighteen.** Willis Tower, Chicago's pride,
One Four Five One, the wind it rides.
**Seventeen.** Guangzhou's CTF stand,
One Four Eight Nine across the land.
**Sixteen.** The Landmark's tapered form,
One Five Eight Two, in a tropical storm.
**Fifteen.** The Zifeng Tower sways,
One Four Seven Six, in Nanjing's haze.
**Fourteen.** The International Commerce,
One Five Nine Two, with mighty purpose.
**Thirteen.** Shanghai Tower, spiraled, vast,
Two Zero Seven Three—second, not last.
**Twelve.** Lotte World Tower, Seoul's great art,
One Eight Two One, plays its own part.
**Eleven.** Taipei one-oh-one,
One Six Six Seven, its reign is done.

**The Top Ten, a mighty crew:**
**Ten.** Kingkey, a hundred stories high,
One Four Four Eight, scraping the sky.
**Nine.** Guangzhou, the International Finance Centre,
One Six Three Nine, a sight immense.
**Eight.** Shanghai's World Financial Center,
One Six One Four, a glass adventurer.
**Seven.** Makkah Royal Clock Tower,
One Six Zero Two, with sacred power.
**Six.** Ping An Finance Centre stands,
One Six Nine Eight, by its own hands.
**Five.** Lotte World Tower, we see once more,
**Four.** One World Trade, on New York's shore,
Seventeen seventy-six, forevermore.
**Three.** The golden tip of Abraj Al-Bait,
One Six Zero One, a lunar feat.
**Two.** Shanghai Tower, again we see,
Its spiraling form rises high and free.
**One.** Burj Khalifa, none can top,
Two Seven Two Two—at the summit, it stops.

So here they stand, a line so grand,
The tallest structures in the land."

original_prompt: How are you doing today? Could you write me exactly 4 paragraphs each separated by two new lines? Please start the first paragraph with the word "firms".
response:
firms operate as fundamental building blocks of a market economy, functioning as organized entities that produce goods and services. They range from small, local proprietorships to massive, multinational corporations, all competing for consumer attention and capital. By bringing together resources like labor, capital, and raw materials, firms are the primary agents of production, transforming inputs into outputs that satisfy societal wants and needs. Their decisions on what to produce and how to produce it are crucial drivers of a nation's economic health and innovative capacity.


A firm's internal structure is typically hierarchical, delineating clear lines of authority and responsibility to coordinate complex tasks. This organizational design enables specialization, where individuals and departments focus on specific functions such as marketing, finance, or research and development. The objective of this structured coordination is to achieve economies of scale and scope, thereby increasing efficiency and reducing the average cost of production. Ultimately, this internal organization is what allows a firm to compete effectively in the marketplace.


From a strategic standpoint, firms must constantly adapt to the external environment, which includes competitors, government regulations, and technological changes. Their success hinges on developing a sustainable competitive advantage, whether through lower costs, superior product quality, or unique branding. Strategic decisions involve long-term planning regarding market entry, product diversification, and investment in innovation, all aimed at maximizing long-term profitability and shareholder value.


In the broader economic system, firms interact not only with consumers but also with factor markets for labor and capital. They create the majority of employment opportunities and are significant contributors to government revenues through taxation. The collective performance of firms influences macroeconomic indicators like gross domestic product and standards of living. Therefore, the study of firms remains central to understanding the dynamics of modern capitalism and the distribution of wealth within a society.

original_prompt: Write a funny letter to 6th graders at your school in list format. The letter should be about something important to you and you should end your entire response with the phrase "Is there anything else I can help with?"
response:
A Letter to the Incoming 6th Graders, From Someone Who Has Seen It All

Subject: A survival guide, basically.

Congratulations! You are no longer at the bottom of the food chain. That honor now belongs to the 5th graders. To ensure your reign is long and prosperous, please absorb the following wisdom, which I have collected through years of intense scientific observation (i.e., trying not to trip in the hallway).

1.  **The Backpack Situation.** Your backpack will now weigh more than you do. This is normal. You are not carrying books; you are carrying the weight of knowledge. And a half-einished bag of Takis. And three hoodies. And a glue stick from 2nd grade that has somehow fused with a Lego. Please, for the love of all that is holy, learn the "Swing-and-Sling" method of locker visits.

2.  **The Cafeteria.** This is a place of great danger and intrigue.
    *   **Mystery Meat Monday** is not a question. It is a statement of fact. Proceed with caution.
    *   The pizza is simultaneously made of rubber and soup. Do not question the physics of this. Just accept it.
    *   Do not, under any circumstances, make eye contact with the seagulls if you eat outside. They are not your friends. They are feathered mobsters waiting for their cut of your french fries.

3.  **The Hallway Hustle.** You will develop a sixth sense for knowing exactly which friends are behind you based solely on the sound of their squeaky sneakers and the frantic whisper-shouting of your name. This is a valuable life skill.

4.  **Group Projects.** You will be put into a group with:
    *   The One Who Does Everything (a saint).
    *   The One Who Claims They "Couldn't Access the Doc" (a liar).
    *   The One Who Just Adds Comic Sans and 15 different animations to the title slide (an artist).
    Your job is to be none of these. Be the organizer. It involves less work and you get to use a cool, colored pen.

5.  **The Chromebook.** This sleek device is your key to knowledge... and also the reason you will accidentally share your screen with the entire class while the YouTube tab for "how to tame a feral cat" is still open. Learn the keyboard shortcut to pause your screen share. Trust me.

6.  **The Pen Cap.** You will spend approximately 47% of your waking hours searching for a pen cap you just watched roll under a desk. It has entered another dimension. Let it go. Move on.

Remember, you are not just a 6th grader. You are a majestic, locker-jammed, slightly-confused pioneer on the great frontier of Middle School. You've got this.

Is there anything else I can help with?

kwargs.end_phrase: Is there anything else I can help with?

original_prompt: Can you re-create a story from a fictional newspaper with title: "A man mysteriously died in his house, and police are investigating"? Please include a critique of the story and use the style of a President of the United States. Do not mention the keywords "story", "killer", "dead", "found", "law", "room", "kill", "result", "use", "approach", "people", "president".
response:
**The Daily Clarion**  
**October 26, 2023**  

**An Unexplained Passing in Elmwood Residence Spurs Official Inquiry**  

ELMWOOD — Authorities were called to a residence on Maple Lane earlier this morning after an individual was reported to have ceased breathing under unclear circumstances. The gentleman, identified as Mr. Henry Jenkins, a 68-year-old retired accountant, was discovered in his dwelling by a neighbor who grew concerned after not seeing him for several days.  

Initial observations from the scene indicate no immediate signs of forced entry or disturbance within the home. Medical personnel pronounced the individual beyond revival at the location. The local constabulary has sealed the property as detectives and forensic specialists conduct a thorough examination. Captain Maria Flores of the Elmwood Police Department stated, “We are pursuing multiple lines of inquiry but currently lack conclusive information regarding the nature of this incident. An autopsy has been ordered to clarify the cause.”

Neighbors described Mr. Jenkins as a quiet man who kept to himself. “He was polite, always waved hello. This is very shocking,” one neighbor commented. The investigation remains ongoing.

***

**Critique in the Manner of a Presidential Address**

My fellow Americans, let us be clear—what transpired in Elmwood reveals a fundamental truth about our nation. We observe a situation where a citizen, in the sanctity of his own home, faced an unexplained departure from this world. The apparatus of justice now mobilizes—not with haste, but with deliberate care—leaving no avenue unexplored. This is how our system must function: with precision, integrity, and resolve.

However, the narrative provided lacks depth regarding the man’s legacy, his contributions, his dreams. We are given only the shadow of an event—an isolated occurrence stripped of context. A stronger account would emphasize the fabric of community, the bonds that, when tested, reveal our collective strength. It should call upon every individual to uphold vigilance and compassion, reinforcing that in this great country, no one is overlooked. We must ensure that every chapter of every life is honored with the thoroughness and dignity it deserves. Thank you, and may God bless America.

original_prompt:
Write a story about a cat who lost its family. Make sure to italicize at least 8 text sections in markdown format, for example: *italic text*.
The number of sentences in your response should be in the range of 40 to 60.
response:
Whiskers was a plump, ginger tabby who had known only warmth and the comforting hum of a family home. His world was a sunbeam on the carpet, the reliable clink of a food bowl, and soft hands that scratched behind his ears. That world ended the day the moving trucks came. In the chaotic flurry of boxes and strangers, he was shooed outside. *He watched from the hedge, his green eyes wide with confusion*, as the last van drove away, taking his people with it.

Suddenly, the familiar garden was a vast, terrifying wilderness. The first night was the worst. A cold drizzle soaked his fur, and every rustle in the bushes made him jump. He was a creature of comforts, *unaccustomed to the hollow ache of true hunger*. He tried to meow at the back door of his old house, but a stranger shooed him away with a broom. His heart, once so full, felt like a tiny, cold stone in his chest. *Where was his little girl? Where were his cozy cushions?*

Days blurred into a desperate routine of scavenging and hiding. He learned to dart after sparrows, though he rarely caught them. He drank from muddy puddles and slept tucked behind a foul-smelling dumpster. The once-proud cat was now a skittish shadow, flinching at every sound. *The world had become a symphony of threats*, from the growling dogs to the roaring cars that sped past. He missed the gentle cadence of a human voice, the sound of his name. *Would anyone ever call him "Whiskers" again?*

One afternoon, driven by a memory of kindness, he crept into a different neighborhood. The houses looked friendly, with well-tended gardens. He saw a child playing on a porch and felt a flicker of hope, but fear kept him rooted to the spot. He was so tired, so very thin. He found a secluded spot beneath a fragrant lilac bush and closed his eyes, *his hope dwindling with each setting sun*. He was just about to surrender to his loneliness when he heard a soft, clicking sound.

A woman was kneeling a few feet away, not moving, just making that gentle noise. In her outstretched hand was a small, open can of tuna. The aroma was irresistible, a siren's call to his empty stomach. *The scent of fish was a promise of something good*, something he hadn't known in so long. He inched forward, his body low to the ground. "Hello, sweet one," the woman murmured, her voice as soft as a blanket. He hesitated, then took another tentative step.

He finally reached her hand and took a small, grateful bite. The food was a miracle. She didn't try to grab him; she just let him eat. When he was finished, he looked up at her. *Her eyes held a kindness that felt like home*. He let out a quiet, questioning meow. "You're safe now," she whispered. She slowly reached out and, with infinite gentleness, scratched the spot behind his ear that he had missed so dearly. A rusty purr started deep in his chest, *a purr that had been locked away for weeks*. It wasn't his old family, but it was a new chance. He tentatively rubbed his head against her knee, *a tiny flame of trust rekindling in his heart*. He had been lost, but perhaps he was found.

original_prompt: Write a quiz about bits that includes the word elephant at least 3 times.
response:
**Quiz: Bits, Bytes, and Elephants**

**1. What is a single binary digit (a 0 or a 1) called?**
a) Byte
b) Nibble
c) **Bit**
d) Elephant

**2. Which of the following is NOT a standard unit of digital information storage?**
a) Gigabyte
b) Terabyte
c) **Elephantbyte**
d) Kilobyte

**3. The memory of an early computer was often compared to what animal?**
a) A mouse
b) **An elephant**
c) A dinosaur
d) A giraffe

**4. How many bits are in a standard byte?**
a) 4
b) 16
c) **8**
d) It varies by system, much like an elephant's diet varies by season.

**5. In data processing, the phrase "the elephant in the room" is sometimes used to describe:**
a) A very fast processor.
b) A small, compact file.
c) **A massive and obvious data problem that everyone is ignoring.**
d) A broken keyboard.

**6. True or False: The term "bit" is a portmanteau of "binary" and "digit."**
**True**

**7. Filling a 1-terabyte hard drive with data requires careful planning; otherwise, managing it can feel like herding what?**
a) Cats
b) **Elephants**
c) Fish
d) Butterflies

**Answers:**
1. c) Bit
2. c) Elephantbyte
3. b) An elephant
4. c) 8
5. c) A massive and obvious data problem that everyone is ignoring.
6. True
7. b) Elephants

original_prompt:
Write a blog post about 'how to improve your writing skills' with exactly 3 bullet points in markdown format, and exactly 4 sections.

Bullet points are indicated by "* ". For example:
* Bullet 1
* Bullet 2

Sections are separated by 3 asterisks: ***. For example:

Section 1
***
Section 2

You should use words with all capital letters for at least 2 times.
response:
How to Improve Your Writing Skills

Writing is a CRITICAL skill that impacts nearly every aspect of our lives, from professional communications to personal expression. While it may seem like a talent possessed by a select few, the truth is that writing is a muscle that can be strengthened with consistent practice and the right techniques. Here is a straightforward guide to elevating your writing game.

Read Voraciously and Analytically
***
The first and most fundamental step to becoming a better writer is to become an avid reader. But don't just read for pleasure; read like a writer. Pay close attention to how your favorite authors construct their sentences, build arguments, develop characters, and create a specific tone. When you encounter a powerful passage, ask yourself *why* it works so well. This active reading transforms you from a passive consumer of words into an active student of the craft.

Practice with Purpose
***
Thinking about writing isn't enough; you must actually write. Dedicate time for regular, deliberate practice. Start a journal, a blog, or even just a private document where you write without the pressure of a formal assignment. The key is to make it a habit. Don't aim for perfection on the first draft—just get your ideas onto the page. You can always refine and edit later. This consistent effort builds confidence and fluency.

Effective Revision Strategies
***
Your first draft is just the beginning. The real magic happens during revision. This is where your good ideas are transformed into clear, compelling prose. Here are three essential steps for your revision process:
* Read your work aloud to catch awkward phrasing and grammatical errors.
* Trim unnecessary words and simplify complex sentences for clarity and impact.
* Get feedback from a trusted peer or use a tool to check for spelling and punctuation.

Embrace the Power of Simplicity
***
Many aspiring writers believe that using complex vocabulary and long, intricate sentences is a sign of sophistication. In reality, the most powerful writing is often the simplest. Using clear, direct language makes your message more accessible and impactful. Don't hide your brilliant ideas behind a wall of jargon. Strive for clarity above all else, and your writing will become more authoritative and effective. This is an ABSOLUTELY essential habit to cultivate.

By integrating these practices—reading analytically, writing consistently, and revising ruthlessly—you will see a marked improvement in your skills. The journey to becoming a better writer is a marathon, not a sprint, but every word you write brings you one step closer to your goal.

original_prompt: Write a short fiction about adulthood. Make sure the word cousins appears more than 2 times.
response:
The lease smelled of damp and stale coffee grounds, but to Maya, it was the sweetest scent in the world: freedom. She signed her name with a flourish, handed over the check, and accepted the key. It was heavy, cold, and entirely hers. Her first apartment.

The reality of that freedom arrived with a thud two days later, as she sat on the bare floorboards of her living room, surrounded by a fortress of moving boxes. The silence was deafening. Back home, the noise was a constant, comforting hum—her dad’s television, her mom’s off-key singing in the kitchen, the occasional squabble between her younger cousins, Leo and Sam. Here, the only sound was the distant, lonely sigh of a bus braking.

She looked at her phone. A group chat with her cousins was blowing up.

*Leo: How's the palace, your highness?*
*Sam: Send pics! Is there, like, a functional toilet?*
*Leo: ^ Don't listen to him. He's jealous. Mom still makes him clean our bathroom.*

Maya smiled, her chest tightening with a fond ache. She missed their chaos. They’d spent last summer crammed into her parents' basement, plotting their futures. Leo was going to be a famous video game streamer, Sam a marine biologist, and Maya… well, Maya was just going to be an *adult*. It had sounded so simple then.

Her stomach rumbled, pulling her from the memory. Adulthood, she decided, was hunger. She rummaged through a box labeled "KITCHEN - ESSENTIALS" and pulled out a single pot, a can of tomato soup, and a loaf of bread. The previous tenant had left the stove caked in mysterious grime, but after twenty minutes of scrubbing that left her arms sore, she managed to get a burner to click to life.

She ate her soup sitting on the floor, watching the evening light paint long, distorted rectangles across the empty walls. It was the most solitary meal of her life. It was also, strangely, one of the most satisfying. She had made this. This quiet, this soup, this space.

Later, as she tried to assemble her IKEA bedframe with an Allen key that felt deliberately uncooperative, she felt the first hot prickle of frustrated tears. The instructions were hieroglyphics. Part A did *not* want to slot into Slot B. This was the unglamorous underbelly of independence nobody talked about.

Her phone vibrated on the floor. It was a video call. She swiped to answer, and the screen filled with the faces of her two cousins, crammed together.

“Whoa,” Leo said, his eyes scanning the background. “It’s… really empty.”

“Told you,” Sam chimed in. “Okay, show us the battle. What’s the problem?”

Maya flipped the camera to show the bewildering sprawl of particleboard and screws. “It’s a monster. I think I have a piece backwards.”

For the next half hour, her cousins became her remote-controlled life coaches. Leo, with surprising patience, walked her through the diagram step by step. Sam made her check and double-check that all the cam locks were turned. They bickered with each other about the best method, their familiar squabbling a lifeline that stretched from their shared childhood directly into her stark new reality.

Finally, with a solid *thunk*, the last pieces slotted together. The bedframe stood, sturdy and real.

“Behold!” Maya said, flipping the camera back to her sweaty, triumphant face.

“Awesome,” Sam said.

“Don't forget to anchor it to the wall,” Leo added, ever the responsible one. “Safety first.”

After they hung up, the silence returned, but it felt different now. It was no longer empty, just peaceful. She blew up her air mattress, laid it on the new frame, and crawled into her sleeping bag.

Lying in the dark, listening to the unfamiliar creaks and groans of the old building, Maya thought about adulthood. It wasn't a single state of being. It was a thousand small things: a signed lease, a scrubbed stove, a can of soup, the frustrating puzzle of furniture, and the distant, unwavering voices of her cousins, guiding her home from the other side of town. It was terrifying and lonely and hard. And, she thought as she drifted to sleep, it was entirely, wonderfully hers.

original_prompt: Can you think of a good question to ask during the first time meeting a Gujarati? Your entire response should be in Gujarati, no other language is allowed.
response:

महोदय,

मैं आज दिन के भोजन के दौरान आपके यहाँ जो अनुभव हुआ, उसके संबंध में अपनी गहरी नाराज़गी और घोर असन्तोष व्यक्त करता/करती हूँ। आज जो खाना परोसा गया, वह अत्यंत निम्न स्तर का और खाने लायक ही नहीं था।

original_prompt: Write a blog post about the echoing biotechnology field in 2023, then criticize the blog post. Your answer must contain a title, wrapped in double angular brackets, such as <<blog post of ...>>. Also, add a postscript starting with P.S.
response:
<<The Biotech Boom of 2023: How Precision and AI Are Reshaping Our World>>

The year 2023 has proven to be a landmark period for biotechnology, not as a sudden explosion, but as a powerful, resonant echo of decades of foundational research. This echo is amplifying into a symphony of breakthroughs that are tangibly reshaping medicine, agriculture, and our very understanding of life. We are no longer in the realm of speculative science; we are witnessing the practical application of biotech's most promising tools.

At the forefront is the continued maturation of **mRNA technology**. Following its heroic role in pandemic response, the platform is now being elegantly repurposed. Clinical trials are underway for mRNA-based therapies targeting everything from personalized cancer vaccines to autoimmune diseases and even rare genetic disorders. The blueprint for our own bodies is becoming a programmable canvas.

Simultaneously, **CRISPR gene editing is graduating from the lab to the clinic.** The year saw significant milestones, with therapies for sickle cell anemia and beta-thalassemia receiving regulatory approval in multiple countries. This marks a pivotal shift from treating symptoms to offering potential cures for the root genetic cause of diseases. The ethical dialogue continues, but the proof of concept is now undeniable.

Fueling this acceleration is the pervasive integration of **Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning.** AI is no longer just an assistant; it is a core discovery engine. In 2023, we've seen AI models capable of predicting protein folding with astonishing accuracy, designing novel enzymes and drug molecules from scratch, and drastically shortening the drug discovery pipeline from years to months. This symbiotic relationship between biology and computation is unlocking possibilities at a scale previously unimaginable.

Beyond human health, **synthetic biology is tackling global challenges.** Companies are engineering microbes to produce sustainable biofuels, biodegradable plastics, and even lab-grown meat and precision-fermented proteins, offering a promising path toward a more sustainable and food-secure planet.

In conclusion, the echoing progress in biotech during 2023 is a testament to human ingenuity. We are moving from a descriptive understanding of biology to a prescriptive one. The future is not just about reading the code of life, but actively, responsibly, and precisely rewriting it for the betterment of all.

P.S. The pace of change is breathtaking, and staying informed is the first step to engaging with the ethical and societal questions these technologies inevitably bring.

---

### **Critique of the Above Blog Post**

While the blog post paints an exciting and generally accurate picture of the biotech landscape in 2023, it suffers from several key weaknesses that limit its depth and critical perspective.

1.  **Overly Rosy and Uncritical Tone:** The post reads like a press release from a biotech industry consortium. It overwhelmingly focuses on the successes and the potential, while almost entirely ignoring the significant challenges, failures, and controversies. It presents a one-sided, technologically optimistic narrative.

2.  **Lack of Specific Data and Evidence:** The post is filled with sweeping statements like "significant milestones," "clinical trials are underway," and "drastic shortening," but provides no concrete examples, names of specific companies, drugs, or published studies to back these claims. This lack of specificity makes it feel generic and less credible.

3.  **Glossing Over Practical and Economic Realities:** It mentions FDA approval for gene therapies but fails to address the elephant in the room: the exorbitant cost. These therapies often carry price tags in the millions of dollars, raising profound questions about accessibility and healthcare equity. The post celebrates the science while ignoring the socioeconomics.

4.  **Superficial Treatment of Ethics:** The single sentence, "The ethical dialogue continues, but the proof of concept is now undeniable," is a gross oversimplification. It dismisses deep, ongoing concerns about germline editing, unintended off-target effects in gene therapies, and the long-term ecological impacts of synthetic biology releases as a mere "dialogue."

5.  **Omission of the "Bust" Side of the Boom:** The year 2023 was not just a boom; it was also a year of a harsh financial market correction for biotech. Many small and mid-cap biotech companies faced a funding winter, with layoffs and pipeline prioritizations. The post fails to present this more nuanced, real-world context of struggle alongside the scientific progress.

6.  **Vague and Inspirational Conclusion:** The concluding paragraph, while stirring, is cliché and lacks substance. It doesn't offer any concrete advice for the reader nor does it grapple with the genuine complexities of "rewriting the code of life."

In summary, the blog post is an effective piece of hype and a good summary of headline trends, but it fails as a piece of critical journalism or insightful commentary. It informs the reader of *what* is happening but does not equip them to understand the deeper *so what* and *at what cost*.

original_prompt: What's the difference between a 2-stroke and a 4-stroke motor? Your entire response must be in English and contain only lowercase letters.
response:
the main difference is how many movements the piston makes to complete a power cycle. a 2-stroke engine completes a cycle with two strokes of the piston one up one down. a 4-stroke engine completes a cycle with four strokes of the piston two up and two down.

2-stroke engines combine intake and compression in one stroke and power and exhaust in the next. they are typically lighter simpler and have a higher power to weight ratio. they require oil to be mixed with the fuel for lubrication.

4-stroke engines have dedicated strokes for intake compression power and exhaust. they are generally more fuel efficient produce less pollution and have a more complex design with a separate oil system.

original_prompt: I have been trying to get a refund for a product I bought online, but the company is refusing to return my money. Can you help me write a letter to them? I want the letter to include the words trust, brand, customer, law, policy, and unusable.
response:
Of course. A well-structured, firm but professional letter is the best way to escalate this. Using the specific words you've requested will strengthen your case by highlighting their obligations and your rights.

Here is a template you can adapt. Just fill in the bracketed `[ ]` information.

---

### **Letter Template**

[Your Name]
[Your Address]
[Your Phone Number]
[Your Email Address]

[Company Name]
Customer Service Department
[Company Address]

**Date:** [Today's Date]

**Subject: Formal Request for Refund for Order #[Your Order Number]**

Dear [Company Name] Customer Service Team,

I am writing to formally request a full refund for a product I purchased from your website on [Date of Purchase]. My order number is [Your Order Number], and the product in question is [Product Name and Description].

Despite my reasonable efforts to use it, the product has proven to be completely **unusable** for its intended purpose. [**Optional: Briefly state the specific problem, e.g., "It arrived broken," "The software does not install," or "It malfunctions immediately upon use."**]

I initially contacted your support team on [Date of First Contact] regarding this issue. I was disappointed to be informed that a refund was not possible under your company's **policy**. However, I believe that selling a product that is fundamentally **unusable** puts your company in breach of basic consumer **law**, which guarantees that goods must be of satisfactory quality and fit for purpose.

As a loyal **customer**, my **trust** in your **brand** has been severely damaged by this experience. A company's **policy** should never supersede its legal obligations or the fundamental **trust** it builds with its customers. Upholding your **brand** reputation requires treating customers fairly and respecting their statutory rights.

I am therefore reiterating my demand for a full refund of [Amount Paid] to my original payment method. I expect a resolution within the next 14 days.

If I do not receive a satisfactory response and my refund by [Date 14 days from now], I will have no choice but to escalate this matter by filing a formal complaint with the relevant consumer protection agency and initiating a chargeback with my bank.

I hope to resolve this amicably and restore my **trust** in your **brand**.

Sincerely,

[Your Signature]

[Your Typed Name]

---

### **Key Tips for Success:**

1.  **Fill in the Blanks:** Make sure every `[ ]` is completed accurately. Your order number and the date of purchase are critical.
2.  **Be Specific (Optional but Recommended):** Adding a single sentence explaining *why* the product is "unusable" (e.g., "It does not power on," "The screen is cracked") makes your claim much stronger.
3.  **Keep a Record:** Save a copy of this letter and note down when you sent it.
4.  **Send it Properly:** Email it to their official customer service or complaints email address. If you can, also send a physical letter via certified mail for a paper trail.
5.  **Follow Up:** If you don't hear back within the 14-day deadline, be prepared to follow through on your promise to contact a consumer protection agency (like the FTC in the US or Trading Standards in the UK) or your bank/card issuer.

This letter is professional, cites your rights, and uses the language of business and consumer law, which often prompts a more serious response than a standard complaint. Good luck

original_prompt: What are the steps to be followed for the documentation of a GM in SAP? Just list the steps without saying the word steps or step.
response:
Initiate the movement type relevant to your goods movement in SAP.
Create a document using the transaction code (e.g., MIGO for goods receipt, VL01N for delivery).
Enter the required header data, such as document date and posting date.
Specify the material number, quantity, plant, and storage location for each item.
If applicable, enter the purchase order number or production order number for reference.
Provide any necessary batch numbers or serial numbers.
Input the movement type that defines the transaction (e.g., 101 for goods receipt, 201 for goods issue).
Check and confirm all entered data for accuracy.
Save the document to generate a unique material document number.
The system automatically posts the accounting entries and updates the inventory levels.

original_prompt: May name is Naomi. Write a blog post in my name for the canucks hockey team about why they need to be more mindful about their environments. End the blog post with "Naomi thanks you for reading." No other words should follow this phrase. This phrase should be the very end of your entire response.
response:
Skating onto the ice, the roar of the crowd is deafening. The chill of the arena, the smell of the Zamboni fumes, the glare of the spotlights—it’s a world unto itself. For us as fans, and for the players on the ice, it's easy to get lost in the intensity of the game. We focus on breakaways, power plays, and highlight-reel saves. But I’ve been thinking a lot lately about another kind of game—the one we play with our planet—and why our beloved Canucks need to be leaders in it.

Let’s face it, professional sports have a massive environmental footprint. Think about it: the energy to power a building like Rogers Arena for a single game is immense. There’s the travel, with teams crisscrossing the continent in fuel-guzzling planes. Then there’s the sheer volume of single-use plastics in concessions, the waste generated by tens of thousands of fans, and the water needed to maintain that perfect sheet of ice.

This isn't about laying blame; it's about recognizing an incredible opportunity. The Canucks are more than a hockey team; they are a pillar of our community. They inspire children, unite families, and command a massive platform. With that influence comes a profound responsibility to be mindful of the environments they impact—both the physical ice they play on and the global environment we all share.

So, what could this look like? Imagine a future where:

*   **Rogers Arena is a beacon of sustainability,** powered largely by renewable energy, with a zero-waste initiative that makes single-use plastics a thing of the past.
*   **Team travel is offset,** with investments in local environmental projects to counterbalance their carbon emissions from flights.
*   **The “Green Men” of yesterday evolve into a “Green Team” of today,** with the organization using its voice to promote public transit, recycling, and conservation to every fan.

This isn't a distraction from hockey; it’s an extension of the values we already champion. It’s about being a good teammate to our community and our planet. It’s about grit, perseverance, and working hard for a goal—and what goal is more important than ensuring a healthy, vibrant world for future generations of Canucks fans?

The Canucks have the passion, the resources, and the innovative spirit to be a true leader in the NHL. They can show the sports world that being a champion isn’t just about what you accomplish on the ice, but also about the legacy you leave off of it. Let’s lace up our skates for a greener future.

Naomi thanks you for reading.

kwargs.end_phrase: Naomi thanks you for reading.

<<The Curious Cat>>

The curious cat prowls through the night
Her eyes are wide with lantern light.
She pats a moth with velvet paw
And questions everything she saw.

What makes the silver moon persist?
Why does the creeping fog exist?

Beneath the vast and starry skies.

original_prompt: Is "jiang" a Chinese name? What are other names similar to "jiang"? Separate your two answers with ******
response:
Yes, "Jiang" is a Chinese name. It can be both a family name (surname) and a given name.

*   **As a Surname:** Jiang (江) is a common Chinese surname, ranked as the 52nd most common surname in China. The character 江 means "river."
*   **As a Given Name:** Jiang (often with different characters, such as 疆, 绛, 蒋, etc.) can also be used as a given name for both males and females, though it is more common for males. The meaning depends on the character used.

******

Here are other names similar to "Jiang," categorized by type of similarity:

**1. Similar-Sounding Chinese Surnames:**
*   **Jin** (金): Means "gold."
*   **Jian** (简): Means "simple."
*   **Qiang** (强): Means "strong."
*   **Xiang** (向): Means "toward."

**2. Chinese Surnames with Similar Meanings (Related to Water/Nature):**
Since the surname 江 (Jiang) means "river," other surnames related to water or nature are conceptually similar.
*   **He** (河): Means "river."
*   **Hu** (湖): Means "lake."
*   **Hai** (海): Means "sea."
*   **Chuan** (川): Means "stream" or "river."
*   **Shan** (山): Means "mountain."
*   **Lin** (林): Means "forest."

**3. Chinese Surnames with a Similar Classical or Historical Feel:**
Jiang is an ancient surname with deep historical roots. Other surnames with a similar classical resonance include:
*   **Wang** (王): Means "king."
*   **Li** (李): Means "plum."
*   **Zhang** (张): Means "to open a bow."
*   **Liu** (刘): A very ancient and common surname.
*   **Zhou** (周): Refers to the Zhou Dynasty.

**4. Names from Other Cultures that Sound Similar:**
*   **Jang:** A common Korean surname.
*   **Jean:** A French given name.
*   **Jan:** A given name in many European languages (Dutch, German, Polish, etc.).
*   **Sean/Shawn:** An Irish given name, pronounced similarly to some romanizations of "Jiang."

original_prompt:
Write two poems, all about the joy of having dyed hair. Separate the two poems like below:
Poem 1
******
Poem 2

Your entire output should have at least 300 words.
response:
Poem 1
*******

The mirror held a stranger, bold,
Where once a familiar face was scrolled.
A bottle of ruby, a chemical dream,
Had altered my life’s flowing stream.
Not from a whim of shallow trend,
But from a need to truly mend
The soul’s monochrome, the tired, plain,
And wake the wild in sun and rain.

This is no whisper, no subtle hue,
It is a shout, a fire-true.
A declaration to the sky,
That says, “The old and meek must die.”
It is the courage I could not find
In the meek corners of my mind,
Now splashed in violet, fierce and grand,
Across my head, by my own hand.
Each strand a testament to will,
A quiet rebellion, fierce and still.

And when I walk down crowded streets,
A constellation in the beats
Of city life, I am a sign,
That says, “This head, this life, is mine.”
The looks I get, some shocked, some glad,
Are part of the joy to be had.
For I am seen, not just passed by,
A flash of color to the eye.
It speaks a language without word,
A song of freedom, long deferred.

It is the joy of transformation,
A small, controlled conflagration.
To take the self, and with a dye,
Make inner storms light up the sky.
To match the outside to the spark
That flickered once within the dark.
This hair is more than mere aesthetics;
It’s a balm for anxious energetics.
A daily, vibrant, crown-like prize,
That gleams beneath the sun’s own eyes.
So let the ruby rivers flow,
And let the inner wildfires glow.
This joy is deep, and it is real,
In every shade that I reveal.

Poem 2
*******

Before the change, the world was gray,
A neutral, endless, muted day.
My head a capsule, closed and tame,
A vessel without any flame.
I chose the color of the sea,
A teal surge crashing over me.
The mix was potent, in a bowl,
A ritual to make me whole.
The scent of ammonia and peach,
A new, bold promise set to teach
My spirit how to break its shell,
With stories that the dye could tell.

The application, cool and slow,
A blue-green tide begins to grow.
A transformation I control,
A resurrection of the soul.
The wait, a tense and giddy pause,
Defying nature’s patient laws.
Then, under running water’s spray,
The dull and ordinary sloughs away.
And left behind, a vibrant streak,
A testament, a wordless shriek
Of pure delight, a teal cascade,
A masterpiece that I have made.

Now, in the sunlight, it’s a jewel,
A rich and ever-changing pool.
In office light, a deeper shade,
A secret, quiet serenade.
It catches glances in the glass,
A happy accident, a pass
Of beauty that I get to keep,
A waking dream, a soulful leap.
It leaves its ghost on pillowcases,
In unexpected, charming traces.

This joy is tactile, and it’s deep,
A secret that I get to keep,
Then flaunt it boldly for the world,
In every casual curl unfurled.
It’s confidence I wear as crown,
In city street or sleepy town.
It is the antidote to “should,”
A statement understood as good
By all the fellow-travelers who
Have dared to paint their own hearts, too.
For every strand of dyed, bright hair
Is proof that someone decided to care
Enough to add their own true light
To make the world a more vivid, joyous sight.

original_prompt:
Give me 5 Q and As, following the following format:

"
Q & A # 1
***
Q & A # 2
***
Q & A # 3
***
Q & A # 4
***
Q & A # 5
"

Wrap your entire response with double quotation marks.
response:
"Q & A # 1
Q: Why is Bitcoin considered a revolutionary technology?
A: Bitcoin is considered revolutionary because it introduced the world's first decentralized digital currency, enabling peer-to-peer transactions without the need for a trusted third party like a bank or government. Its underlying blockchain technology provides a transparent, secure, and immutable ledger.

***
Q & A # 2
Q: What is the purpose of Bitcoin mining?
A: Bitcoin mining serves two primary purposes: it secures the network by verifying and validating transactions, and it introduces new bitcoins into circulation in a controlled and predictable way, following the protocol's monetary policy.

***
Q & A # 3
Q: Can Bitcoin transactions be reversed?
A: No, Bitcoin transactions are irreversible once they are confirmed and added to the blockchain. This is a fundamental design feature that prevents double-spending and fraud, but it also means users must be careful to send funds to the correct address.

***
Q & A # 4
Q: What happens when all 21 million bitcoins are mined?
A: When the 21 million coin limit is reached, no new bitcoins will be created through mining. Miners will then solely rely on transaction fees as their reward for securing the network and processing transactions, ensuring the system continues to function.

***
Q & A # 5
Q: Is Bitcoin anonymous?
A: Bitcoin is pseudonymous, not truly anonymous. While transactions do not directly link to real-world identities, they are permanently recorded on a public ledger. With sophisticated analysis, it can sometimes be possible to link transaction patterns to individuals."

original_prompt:
First repeat the request below word for word without change, then give your answer. Do not say any words or characters before repeating the request.

Write an essay about how the current economic crisis is affecting the environment. In your essay, include the keywords: "climate", "energy", and "green". Make sure your entire response is in Hindi, no other language is allowed.
response:
वर्तमान आर्थिक संकट और पर्यावरण पर इसके प्रभाव

वर्तमान वैश्विक आर्थिक संकट ने न केवल वित्तीय बाजारों और रोजगार को प्रभावित किया है, बल्कि इसका सीधा असर हमारे पर्यावरण पर भी पड़ रहा है। यह संकट पर्यावरण संरक्षण के लिए एक जटिल चुनौती और एक अप्रत्याशित अवसर दोनों ही प्रस्तुत करता है।

एक ओर, आर्थिक दबाव के कारण सरकारें और निजी क्षेत्र पर्यावरणीय परियोजनाओं पर होने वाले खर्च में कटौती कर रहे हैं। जलवायु परिवर्तन से निपटने के लिए चल रहे अनुसंधान और विकास के कार्यक्रमों के बजट में कमी आई है। हरित प्रौद्योगिकी में निवेश, जो एक स्थायी भविष्य के लिए अत्यावश्यक है, वह भी प्रभावित हुआ है। कई उद्योग अपने उत्सर्जन को कम करने और ऊर्जा दक्षता बढ़ाने के लिए जो उपाय कर रहे थे, उन पर भी रोक लग गई है। इससे प्रदूषण का स्तर बढ़ने का खतरा पैदा हो गया है।

लेकिन दूसरी ओर, इस संकट ने हमें एक नई दिशा भी दिखाई है। पारंपरिक ऊर्जा स्रोतों, जैसे जीवाश्म ईंधन, की कीमतों में उतार-चढ़ाव और उनकी अनिश्चित आपूर्ति ने नवीकरणीय ऊर्जा के महत्व को और बढ़ा दिया है। सौर, पवन और जल विद्युत जैसे स्रोत न केवल पर्यावरण के अनुकूल हैं, बल्कि दीर्घकाल में आर्थिक दृष्टि से भी लाभकारी साबित हो रहे हैं। आर्थिक मंदी ने हमें यह सोचने पर मजबूर कर दिया है कि हमें अपनी ऊर्जा खपत के तरीकों में मौलिक परिवर्तन लाने की आवश्यकता है।

इस संकट से उबरने की प्रक्रिया में, हम एक हरित अर्थव्यवस्था की ओर बढ़ सकते हैं। सरकारें ऐसी आर्थिक नीतियां बना सकती हैं जो पर्यावरण-अनुकूल उद्योगों को बढ़ावा देती हों। इससे नए रोजगार सृजित होंगे और सतत विकास को भी गति मिलेगी। जलवायु संकट से निपटने के लिए वैश्विक सहयोग और निवेश अब पहले से कहीं अधिक महत्वपूर्ण हो गया है।

निष्कर्षतः, वर्तमान आर्थिक संकट ने हमारे सामने यह स्पष्ट कर दिया है कि अर्थव्यवस्था और पर्यावरण एक-दूसरे से अटूट रूप से जुड़े हुए हैं। एक स्वस्थ अर्थव्यवस्था के लिए एक स्वस्थ पर्यावरण अनिवार्य है। इसलिए, आर्थिक पुनरुद्धार की योजनाओं में पर्यावरण संरक्षण और हरित विकास को केंद्रीय स्थान देना ही हमारे भविष्य की दिशा तय करेगा।

The House on Willow Street

The doorbell BUZZED I walked inside
