original_prompt: Write a 600+ word social media post for a startup that provides a platform for running realistic physics simulation. Make sure to include the word "bombs" at least once.
response:
**Subject: The Building Blocks of Reality Are Now Yours to Command.**

Remember being a kid with a set of building blocks? You’d stack them high, imagining sprawling cities, and then, with a mischievous grin, you’d give the bottom block a nudge. The glorious, chaotic crash was half the fun. That childhood instinct—the desire to build, to test, and yes, to watch things fall apart—is rooted in a deep curiosity about how our world works.

Now, imagine having that same playful power, but with the entire, complex, beautiful rulebook of physics as your toy box.

That’s the world we’re building.

We’re not a gaming company. We’re not an animation studio. We are the bedrock for what comes next. We provide a powerful, scalable, and incredibly accurate physics simulation platform for engineers, designers, architects, researchers, and visionaries.

Think of us as the engine for reality.

What does that mean in practice? It means an automotive engineer can simulate a new suspension system navigating a Swiss alpine road with perfect road-texture friction and real-world gravity, thousands of times in an afternoon, before a single gram of steel is ever milled. It means an architect can watch how sunlight tracks through a skyscraper’s atrium at any time of year, or how its glass facade would withstand a category-5 hurricane.

It means a pharmaceutical researcher can model the way a new drug molecule folds and interacts with a protein, shaving years off the development cycle. And yes, it even means effects artists can create movie-quality destruction where every shard of glass and piece of rubble behaves exactly as it should, without relying on pre-canned animations.

This isn’t just about efficiency (though the cost and time savings are monumental). It’s about **freedom**. The freedom to experiment, to fail spectacularly and learn iteratively in a zero-consequence digital sandbox. It’s about asking "What if?" without being constrained by the physical world.

Want to see how a bridge design holds up under an earthquake 0.2 points stronger than the maximum ever recorded? Go for it. Curious about the aerodynamic flow over a radical new drone design? It’s a few clicks away. Need to model the complex fluid dynamics of a new artificial heart valve? The tools are in your hands.

We’ve moved far beyond simple blocks. This is about simulating the very fabric of our universe to build a better, safer, and more innovative future.

And because we believe in transparency and the raw power of testing, our platform allows you to stress-test your creations to their absolute limits. You can push boundaries and explore scenarios you'd never dare to in the real world—from the safest car crash to the most resilient building design. In our simulated world, you can set the parameters, run the simulation, and learn from the outcome, whether it’s a perfect success or a spectacular, informative failure. It’s a place where you can safely test theories and deconstruct ideas, all without any real-world **bombs**—metaphorical or otherwise—causing irreversible damage.

This is more than a tool; it's a paradigm shift. We're handing you the keys to a digital universe that plays by our universe's rules. The potential is limited only by your imagination.

The future isn't just about building things. It's about understanding them, from the ground up.

**What will you simulate first?**

#PhysicsEngine #Simulation #Innovation #DigitalTwins #Engineering #FutureTech #Design #R&D #WhatIf #SimulateReality

Do not use any commas in your response.

Why settle for one colorway when you can own them all? Express your individuality without buying multiple pairs of shoes.* This isn't just fashion; it's functional creativity.

Of course, a killer look means nothing if you can’t wear it from first period to a late-night hangout without a second thought. That’s where our advanced technology takes over. The Aura Glide is built around our proprietary Cloud Cell midsole, which features thousands of tiny, responsive pods that absorb impact and rebound with every step. *Imagine walking on a lattice of perfectly tuned, energy-returning springs. This isn’t just cushioning; it’s an active suspension system for your life, reducing fatigue whether you’re navigating crowded hallways, standing in line for concert tickets, or chasing the golden hour for the perfect Instagram story.* The seamless, knit-vamp upper feels like a sock, molding to your foot for a flawless, no-break-in-needed fit that breathes, keeping you cool and comfortable all day long.

original_prompt: Write a short, funny story about a man named Harry with a pet dog. Your response must contain 3 sections, mark the beginning of each section with SECTION X.
response:
SECTION 1
Harry's dog, Barnaby, was a Basset Hound whose defining features were a profound skepticism of the vacuum cleaner and a near-magical ability to locate food particles within a three-mile radius. Harry loved him dearly, though he often suspected Barnaby's jowls operated on a separate, more cynical intelligence than the rest of his body. Their life was a comfortable routine of walks, naps, and debating whether the mailman was a friend or a fiend.

SECTION 2
One Tuesday, Harry decided to bake. He was not a good baker. His attempt at a "simple" lemon drizzle cake resulted in a dense, lopsided brick that smelled vaguely of burnt optimism. Disheartened, he left the atrocity on the kitchen counter and went to answer the door for a package delivery. When he returned, Barnaby was on the floor, looking profoundly disappointed. The cake was untouched. The dog had sniffed, considered, and given Harry's creation a culinary one-star review. Harry wasn't sure what was more insulting: the cake's failure, or the fact that a creature who regularly drank from the toilet had found it unworthy.

SECTION 3
Determined to win back his dog's gustatory respect, Harry went to the pet store and bought a single, premium, gourmet dog biscuit shaped like a bone. He presented it to Barnaby with a flourish. Barnaby sniffed it, then looked at Harry, then back at the biscuit. With a sigh that seemed to say, "Fine, we'll try this, but my standards remain high," he gently took the treat and ambled to his bed. Harry felt a surge of victory. Then he saw Barnaby simply place the biscuit on his pillow and lie down next to it, staring. The gourmet treat was now, apparently, an artisanal paperweight.

original_prompt: Can you compose a movie plot that involves dream, fist fighting, and superpower? Include a title in double angular brackets, i.e. <<title>>.
response:
Of course. Here is a movie plot.

<<The Dreamer's Fist>>

**Logline:** A washed-up underground fighter discovers his vivid dreams are visions of a parallel world, and that by mastering a unique fighting style in his reality, he can wield devastating superpowers in the other to prevent a catastrophic war.

**Plot:**

**Act I: The Visions**
Leo is a former champion of the "Circuit," a brutal, unsanctioned fighting league. Now in his late 30s, he works a dead-end job and suffers from cripplingly vivid nightmares. Each night, he dreams of a war-torn, neon-drenched city called "Oneria," where people with incredible superpowers—telekinetics, energy projectors, elemental benders—battle in the streets. He always witnesses these events through the eyes of a powerful, anonymous hero fighting for the rebellion.

After a particularly intense dream leaves him with real, physical bruises, Leo's life falls further apart. He's fired for his exhaustion and gets into a street fight where, in a moment of desperation, he unconsciously uses a subtle telekinetic push to save himself. He is then approached by a mysterious woman named Elara. She reveals she is from Oneria, and that his "dreams" are not dreams at all—he is psychically witnessing a parallel dimension in real-time. More importantly, she explains that Oneria and Earth are linked: mastery of physical combat on Earth directly translates to the control of a specific superpower in Oneria.

**Act II: The Training**
Elara explains that Leo is a rare "Anchor," a person whose consciousness can bridge the two worlds with perfect fidelity. The hero he's been seeing through is his Onerian counterpart, who is a key figure in their rebellion against a tyrannical regime. However, the Onerian rebellion is losing, and a cataclysmic weapon is being built that could shatter the dimensional barrier, destroying both worlds.

To help, Leo must re-enter the world of fist-fighting. But this time, it's not for money or glory. He must learn to fight with a pure, focused intent, a "flow state" that his Onerian self can channel into superhuman abilities. As Leo trains in old, forgotten dojos and re-enters the brutal Circuit, he begins to see direct results. When he perfects a new combination in a real fight, his Onerian counterpart manifests the ability to create solid, concussive force fields. When he masters evasion and redirection, his counterpart gains the power to deflect energy blasts.

**Act III: The Duel of Realities**
The final act cuts between two simultaneous, interlinked climaxes. On Earth, Leo has fought his way to the championship of the Circuit. His opponent is a monstrous, undefeated fighter who is revealed to be the "Anchor" for the Onerian regime's warlord. Their fight is no longer just for a title; it is the physical conduit for the superpowered battle happening in Oneria.

Back in Oneria, the rebellion's final assault on the regime's citadel is underway. Leo's counterpart, now empowered with the combined abilities Leo has unlocked, confronts the warlord. The Earth fight and the Onerian battle are now perfectly synchronized. Every punch Leo lands on Earth weakens the warlord's defenses in Oneria. Every tactical move Leo makes is mirrored and amplified by his superpowered self.

In the final moment, Leo on Earth is cornered, about to lose. He closes his eyes, finding a perfect state of calm amidst the violence. He doesn't see his opponent's fist; he *feels* it. In a move that is pure instinct, he flows with the punch, redirecting it with a technique he never formally learned. In Oneria, his counterpart performs the same motion, but instead of redirecting a fist, he redirects the warlord's own cataclysmic energy blast back at him, overloading and destroying the dimensional weapon.

**Epilogue:**
The dimensional rift stabilizes. Leo wins the fight on Earth, but walks away from the title, his purpose fulfilled. He now stands as the guardian of the link between the two worlds, having finally found a purpose greater than himself. He continues to train, not for a belt, but to maintain the balance, his fists now a conduit for peace across realities.

original_prompt: Write a blog post about interesting facts about the Dutch language. Italicize at least 2 sections in your answer with markdown, i.e. *italic text*.
response:
Of course! Here is a blog post about interesting facts about the Dutch language.

***

### **Beyond Windmills and Tulips: 10 Fascinating Facts About the Dutch Language**

When people think of the Netherlands, their minds often go to iconic images: bustling Amsterdam canals, sprawling tulip fields, and towering windmills. But the country’s most captivating treasure might just be the language itself. Dutch, or *Nederlands*, is full of delightful quirks and surprises that reflect the nation's unique history and character. Let's dive into some of the most interesting facts about this Germanic tongue.

#### **1. It's the Closest Relative to English**

If German is English's sophisticated older cousin and French is its fashionable friend, then Dutch is its long-lost sibling. Both languages sprouted from the same West Germanic language branch. This is why you'll find countless similarities. Words like *appel* (apple), *huis* (house), and *drinken* (to drink) sound strikingly familiar. An English speaker learning Dutch often has that wonderful "aha!" moment when these linguistic connections become clear.

#### **2. The Quirky Letter Combination: "IJ"**

Dutch has a unique letter (or is it two?) that often confuses newcomers: the **IJ**. Originally a stylized way of writing a capital Y, it has evolved into a letter combination all its own. You'll find it at the beginning of place names like *IJsselmeer* or *IJmuiden*, and it even has its own section in Dutch dictionaries, placed between X and Z. It’s so important that when a word is capitalized, both letters become capitals, like **IJs** (ice).

#### **3. A Language of Diminutives**

The Dutch have a peculiar and endearing fondness for making things small—linguistically, at least. By adding the suffix *-je*, *-tje*, *-etje*, or *-pje* to a noun, they create a diminutive form. This isn't just for physical size; it often conveys cuteness, affection, or endearment.
*Een kopje koffie* (a cup of coffee) feels cozier than just *een kop*. *Een meisje* (a girl) is the standard word, derived from *meid* (maid). It's a linguistic quirk that adds a layer of warmth to everyday conversation.

#### **4. English's Sneaky Linguistic Supplier**

You might be speaking a bit of Dutch without even knowing it. Many common English words were borrowed from Dutch, especially in the realms of sailing, art, and commerce. Words like **yacht**, **deck**, **skipper**, **landscape**, **easel**, and **cookie** (*koekje*, meaning "little cake") all sailed into English from the Low Countries. Even the infamous **Santa Claus** evolved from the Dutch name *Sinterklaas*.

#### **5. Afrikaans: Dutch's Daughter Language**

*Perhaps the most remarkable testament to the durability of Dutch is its direct descendant, Afrikaans. Spoken in South Africa and Namibia, Afrikaans developed from the 17th-century Dutch spoken by settlers. While it has evolved significantly, a speaker of Dutch and a speaker of Afrikaans can often understand each other relatively well, much like Spanish and Portuguese speakers might. Afrikaans simplified Dutch grammar, most notably by dropping verb conjugations for person (e.g., *ik bent*, *jij bent*, *hij is* all become *is* in Afrikaans).*

#### **6. A Consonant-Heavy Tongue Twister**

Think you're good at tongue twisters? Try your hand at some classic Dutch ones that are legendary for their impossible consonant clusters. The classic example is ***"Scheveningse scheepsschroeven"*** (Scheveningen ship's propellers). Or how about ***"Angstige engelachtige angel"*** (Anxious angelic sting)? These phrases are not just fun and games; they were even used during World War II as a shibboleth to identify German spies, who struggled to pronounce the distinctive Dutch *"sch"* sound.

#### **7. The Thrill of the Tongue Roll: The "G"**

One sound defines the Dutch language more than any other: the guttural **G**. Pronounced at the back of the throat, it can sound like a soft clearing of the throat or a much harder, almost scraping sound, depending on the region (softer in the south, harder in the north). Mastering this sound is a rite of passage for any serious learner and is essential for common words like *gezelligheid* (more on that next), *goed* (good), and *gracht* (canal).

#### **8. The Untranslatable "Gezelligheid"**

*If you had to pick one word that encapsulates the soul of Dutch culture, it would be **gezelligheid**. While often translated as "cozy," "quaint," or "fun," it means so much more. It's the warm, convivial atmosphere of a candlelit café with friends. It's the feeling of togetherness at a family dinner. It's the intangible quality that makes a place or moment feel warm, friendly, and enjoyable. It's the opposite of ostentation; it’s about simple, genuine comfort and connection.*

#### **9. It’s a Global Language (in a Niche Way)**

With over 24 million native speakers, Dutch is far from a minor language. It's the official language of the Netherlands, Belgium (Flanders), Suriname, and the Caribbean islands of Aruba, Curaçao, and Sint Maarten. Its reach, both historically and in the modern globalized world, makes it a language of business, culture, and diplomacy.

#### **10. A DNA of Tolerance and Trade**

The Dutch language reflects the Netherlands' history as a seafaring nation of traders. Its vocabulary is a melting pot, borrowing freely from French (e.g., *paraplu* from *parapluie*), German, and even Indonesian (e.g., *pisang* for banana). This linguistic openness mirrors the country's long-standing ethos of global commerce and cultural tolerance.

So, the next time you hear Dutch, listen a little closer. You'll hear the echoes of English, the guttural sounds of its unique character, and the warm, cozy *gezelligheid* that makes it so much more than just the language of windmills and tulips. *Proost!* (Cheers!)

यस दिन तपाईंले आरुघाट भ्रमण गर्न सक्नुहुन्छ। बिराटनगरको प्रसिद्ध ठेला खाना जस्तै मोमो, चाउचाउ, सेकुवा आदि चाख्नुहोस्। स्थानीय मधेशी खानाको स्वाद लिनुहोस्।

सातौं दिन: स्थानीय बजार र खरिद
यस दिन तपाईंले बिराटनगरको स्थानीय बजारमा घुमेर स्थानीय उत्पादनहरू जस्तै मधेशी लुगाहरू, हस्तनिर्मित सामग्री, स्थानीय खाद्यपदार्थ आदि किन्न सक्नुहुन्छ।

आठौं दिन: धरणीधाम मन्दिर र संस्कृति
यस दिन तपाईंले धरणीधाम मन्दिर भ्रमण गर्नुहोस्। यो मन्दिर बिराटनगरको प्रसिद्ध धार्मिक स्थल हो। साँझ स्थानीय संस्कृतिक कार्यक्रम हेर्न जान सक्नुहुन्छ।

नवौं दिन: स्थानीय गाउँ भ्रमण
यस दिन तपाईंले बिराटनगर वरिपरिका गाउँहरू भ्रमण गर्न सक्नुहुन्छ। स्थानीय जीवनशैली, कृषि क्षेत्रहरू र प्राकृतिक दृश्यहरूको आनन्द लिनुहोस्।

दशौं दिन: प्रस्थान
यस दिन बिहान नाश्ता पछि तपाईंले आफ्नो होटलबाट चेकआउट गर्नुहोस् र बिराटनगरबाट प्रस्थान गर्नुहोस्। आवश्यक समानहरू लिएर विमानस्थल वा बस पार्कतर्फ लाग्नुहोस्।

यो योजना तपाईंको रुचि अनुसार परिवर्तन गर्न सकिन्छ। बिराटनगरको यात्रा तपाईंको लागि रमाइलो र जानकारीपूर्ण होस् भनी आशा गर्दछौं।

original_prompt: Write an essay on wilderness preservation. Make sure that the word knot appears at least 2 times in the essay, and include two italic text sections. Like: *this is italic text*
response:
### The Intrinsic Knot of Wilderness Preservation

In an age dominated by human enterprise, the preservation of wilderness stands as a vital counterbalance, a commitment to safeguarding the intricate tapestry of life that operates beyond our direct control. These wild places—untamed forests, expansive deserts, and uncharted mountains—are not merely scenic backdrops for recreation; they are the foundational reservoirs of biodiversity, the lungs of our planet, and the wellspring of spiritual renewal for the human soul. Yet, the effort to protect them presents a profound and complex *knot* of ecological, economic, and ethical considerations that we must patiently and deliberately untangle.

The challenges are innumerable. As human populations swell and development pushes ever outward, wildlands are increasingly fragmented and degraded. The very concept of "wilderness" is threatened, reduced to isolated islands in a sea of human activity. This creates a logistical *knot* for conservationists, who must balance the need for protected corridors for wildlife migration with the pressing demands for resources and space. Furthermore, there is a persistent, misguided notion that land must be either purely productive or purely protected, as if a thriving natural world offers no tangible benefits. *This perspective ignores the essential services that intact ecosystems provide, from purifying our air and water to pollinating our crops and regulating our climate.*

Despite these complexities, the imperative for preservation is clear. Wild ecosystems are libraries of genetic information, holding potential cures for diseases and solutions to future challenges that we cannot yet foresee. They are living laboratories where evolution continues its timeless work, undisturbed. On a more profound level, wilderness offers a sanctuary for the human spirit. In the quiet majesty of an old-growth forest or the stark beauty of a desert canyon, we are reminded of our place within a larger, more ancient order. It is a place to shed the anxieties of modern life and reconnect with something elemental and true. *In preserving wilderness, we are ultimately preserving a part of ourselves—our sense of wonder, our humility, and our connection to the earth that sustains us.*

Ultimately, untying the knot of wilderness preservation requires a shift in consciousness. It demands that we move from seeing nature as a commodity to be exploited to recognizing it as a partner to be respected. It calls for innovative policies that reconcile conservation with sustainable human needs and a collective will to value the wild for its own sake. The wilderness is not a luxury; it is a necessity. Its enduring mystery, its complex and unyielding beauty, is a legacy we must fiercely protect for all generations to come.

original_prompt: Critique the following ad copy for a new dating app, and make sure to include a title wrapped in double angular brackets, i.e. <<title>>: "Meet your new match! Cohen is a free app that matches you with others based on your interests and location. With Cohen, you can find love, friendship, or just someone to swing with. Download Cohen today and start meeting new people!"
response:
<<Unfortunate Naming Ambiguity>>

The provided ad copy has several critical flaws, primarily stemming from a catastrophic naming choice, but also in its lack of strategic focus.

**Primary Critique: The App Name "Cohen"**

This is the most significant and damaging issue. "Cohen" is a common Jewish surname with deep religious and cultural significance. In Judaism, a Kohen (or Cohen) is a member of the priestly class with a specific lineage and traditional roles. Using this name for a dating app, especially one that includes the phrase "someone to swing with," is culturally insensitive and highly inappropriate. It trivializes a sacred identifier. Furthermore, from a purely practical marketing standpoint, it creates a massive brand recognition problem and will likely attract significant negative attention and criticism.

**Additional Critique Points:**

1.  **Weak Opening:** "Meet your new match!" is a generic, overused cliché that fails to capture attention. It does nothing to differentiate the app from countless competitors.
2.  **Unclear Value Proposition:** The copy lists "love, friendship, or just someone to swing with" all in one breath. This lack of focus makes the app's purpose seem confusing and desperate to be everything to everyone. Is it for serious relationships, platonic friends, or casual encounters? This ambiguity can alienate all user segments.
3.  **Missing "Why":** The ad explains *what* the app does ("matches you based on your interests and location") but not *how* it does it better than other apps. What is its unique algorithm or feature? Why is it superior to Hinge, Bumble, or Tinder? The value is not compellingly communicated.
4.  **Weak Call-to-Action (CTA):** "Download Cohen today and start meeting new people!" is another generic command. It lacks urgency or a specific benefit that compels immediate action.

---

### Revised Ad Copy (With a Rebranded Name)

To demonstrate an effective rewrite, we must first change the app's name. Let's assume we've rebranded it to "**Nexus**," which implies connection.

<<Find Your People, Your Way>>

**Headline:** Connection, Curated for You.

**Body:** Tired of swiping through countless profiles that don't align? Nexus is different. Our intelligent matching goes beyond just location to deeply connect you based on shared passions, values, and what you're genuinely looking for.

Whether you're seeking a lasting relationship, new friends for your hobby, or something more casual, Nexus helps you find people on the same page. We create a space where your intentions are clear and respected.

**Call-to-Action:** Ready for more meaningful connections? Download Nexus now and define your own story.

---

### Summary of Key Improvements:

*   **Rebranding:** Addressed the culturally insensitive and problematic name.
*   **Focused Value Proposition:** The revised copy allows for different intentions but frames them in a more respectful and clear manner ("find people on the same page").
*   **Stronger Benefit-Oriented Language:** Uses words like "curated," "meaningful connections," "shared passions," and "intentions are clear" to convey quality and purpose.
*   **Differentiation:** It implicitly positions the app as a solution to the problem of "mindless swiping" on other platforms.
*   **Empowering CTA:** "Define your own story" is more empowering and engaging than a simple "download now."

original_prompt: Give me a pitch deck for a startup that lets me send letters to people in my territory that I don't know personally. The title of the pitch deck should be wrapped in double angular brackets, i.e. <<title>>.
response:
Of course. Here is a complete pitch deck for a startup called "TerritoryGram," designed to help businesses send targeted, physical letters to potential customers in their area.

---

<<TerritoryGram>>

**Deck: Connecting Businesses with Their Neighborhoods, One Letter at a Time**

---

**Slide 1: Title Slide**

**(Image: A person's hand holding a personalized, beautifully designed letter, with a map of a local neighborhood in the background.)**

**TerritoryGram**
*Direct Mail, Reimagined for the Modern Business.*

---

**Slide 2: The Problem**

**(Image: A split screen. On one side, a frustrated small business owner. On the other, a cluttered digital inbox full of spam.)**

*   **Digital Ad Overload:** Consumers are inundated with digital ads, leading to banner blindness and ad fatigue. Cut-through is expensive and inefficient.
*   **The "Local Blind Spot":** Businesses, especially SMBs, have no easy way to personally introduce themselves to every home or apartment in their immediate territory.
*   **Direct Mail is a Hassle:** Traditional direct mail requires design skills, a mailing list, a printer, and postage—a complex, time-consuming process for a busy entrepreneur.

---

**Slide 3: The Solution**

**(Image: A clean, simple dashboard on a laptop screen showing a map, with a few clicks leading to a stack of letters ready to be mailed.)**

**TerritoryGram is a platform that automates hyper-local, physical outreach.**

We allow any business to:
1.  **Define Their Territory:** Draw a zone on a map or select by zip code/radius.
2.  **Craft Their Message:** Use our templates or create a custom letter.
3.  **Click "Send":** We handle the printing, stuffing, stamping, and mailing.

**It’s the simplicity of email, with the impact of direct mail.**

---

**Slide 4: How It Works**

**(Icons for each step: 1. Map Pin, 2. Pen, 3. Envelope, 4. Mailbox)**

1.  **MAP IT**
    *   User defines their target area using our interactive map tool.

2.  **WRITE IT**
    *   User writes their letter using our simple text editor or AI-assisted drafting tool. They can upload a logo and signature.

3.  **PERSONALIZE IT**
    *   Each letter is automatically addressed with the resident's name (e.g., "To our Neighbor at 123 Main St") for a personal touch.

4.  **SEND IT**
    *   We take over. Our system prints, prepares, and mails every letter via USPS. User gets a confirmation and tracking.

---

**Slide 5: The Market Opportunity**

**(Graphic showing a large, growing market size.)**

*   **Total Addressable Market (TAM):** The **$60B+** global direct mail advertising market.
*   **Serviceable Addressable Market (SAM):** **Small & Medium Businesses (SMBs)** in the US alone: over 30 million.
*   **Initial Target Customers:**
    *   Real Estate Agents
    *   Local Restaurants & Cafes
    *   Fitness Studios & Gyms
    *   Home Service Providers (Plumbers, Electricians, Landscapers)
    *   Financial Advisors & Insurance Agents
    *   Retail Stores

---

**Slide 6: Business Model**

**(Clean slide with pricing tiers and icons.)**

**Simple, Scalable Pricing per Letter Delivered**

*   **Starter Plan:** $2.50/letter
    *   Perfect for testing a small neighborhood.
*   **Growth Plan:** $1.99/letter
    *   Volume discounts for larger territories.
*   **Agency Plan:** Custom Pricing
    *   For marketing agencies managing multiple clients.

*Price includes design template, printing, envelope, postage, and our platform fee. No contracts. Pay as you go.*

---

**Slide 7: Why Now? Why Us?**

**(Image: A Venn diagram showing "Physical Touch" and "Digital Convenience" overlapping.)**

**The Perfect Storm for TerritoryGram:**

*   **The Return of Tangible:** In a digital world, a physical letter stands out. It conveys effort, legitimacy, and care.
*   **SMB Digital Exhaustion:** Small business owners are overwhelmed by complex digital ad platforms.
*   **"Hyper-Local" is a Key Trend:** Consumers want to support and know their local community.

**Our Secret Sauce:** We combine the **targeting of a digital ad platform** with the **tactile impact of direct mail**, all in a dead-simple, on-demand interface that anyone can use.

---

**Slide 8: Traction & Early Results**

**(Graphics showing positive metrics: Customer logos, 95% Satisfaction, 15% Avg. Response Rate)**

*   **Successful Beta:** 150+ paying customers acquired through early access.
*   **Proven ROI:** Beta customers report a **15% average response rate** (e.g., coupon redemptions, website visits from QR codes, phone calls).
*   **Customer Love:** "TerritoryGram helped me fill 10 new memberships for my yoga studio in just one month. It was effortless!" – Sarah J., Studio Owner.

---

**Slide 9: The Team**

**(Headshots of the core team members.)**

*   **[Founder CEO]:** Former Head of Growth at [Tech Company], with 10+ years in marketing and SMB SaaS.
*   **[Founder CTO]:** Ex-lead engineer from [Startup], expert in logistics and mapping APIs.
*   **[Head of Sales]:** Previously built the SMB sales team at [Local Service Platform].

**We have the perfect blend of marketing savvy, technical expertise, and sales execution to win this market.**

---

**Slide 10: The Ask**

**(Clean, bold text with a clear call to action.)**

We are raising a **$1.5M Seed Round** to accelerate our growth.

**Funds will be allocated to:**
*   **Product & Engineering (40%):** Scaling our platform and developing new features (e.g., AI copywriting, postcard options).
*   **Sales & Marketing (40%):** Expanding our go-to-market team and launching targeted ad campaigns.
*   **Operations & Team (20%):** Growing our core team and covering initial mailing logistics.

---

**Slide 11: Thank You**

**(TerritoryGram logo and contact information.)**

**Thank You**

**Let's connect businesses with their communities.**

**[Email Address]**
**[Website URL]**
**[Phone Number]**

response:
<<The O.G. Lullaby>>

Yo, listen up, all you pros in the game,
Tired parents callin' out your name.
The baby's up, it's the midnight hour,
And they're lookin' for your superpower.
This ain't magic, it's a science, see,
A structured plan for the family.
So drop the beat and take a seat,
Let's talk about gettin' that solid sleep.

First rule of thumb, set the stage right,
A dark and cool room for slumberin' at night.
A predictable sequence, a wind-down flow,
A warm bath, a story, keep the volume low.
This is the **Pre-Sleep Foundation**,
The non-negotiable start to the operation.
A consistent routine, the signal to the brain,
That it's time to power down and ease the strain.

Next up, the method, the talk of the town,
The gentle approach to lay the fuss down.
You do the routine, place 'em down awake,
So learnin' to self-soothe is the leap they can take.
If they start to cry, you check in at the door,
But don't pick 'em up, just reassure.
This is the **Scheduled Soothing Strategy**,
Builds confidence and independence naturally.
It’s tough at first, but stay the course,
You’re buildin' a skill with a powerful source.

Full belly before bed, that's a solid fact,
But keep the feeds bright, no nappin' on the sack.
Watch the wake windows, don't let 'em get overtired,
That's a one-way ticket to a meltdown, wired.
You're the consultant, the sleep sensei,
With a plan this tight, you'll have 'em sayin' "Goodnight."

P.P.S. Every baby is a unique individual; flexibility within the framework of a consistent plan is key to success.

original_prompt: Write a song about choking on a piece of chicken in the Potomac River. Put the title in double angular brackets, i.e. <<title of my song>>.
response:
<<Chicken on the Potomac>>

(Verse 1)
The sun was high, the river lazy, a gentle D.C. day
I packed a lunch of fried delight to pass the time away
On a bench near Georgetown, watching rowers glide and dip
I took a bite of chicken, a mighty, greedy chip
The batter was so crispy, the meat was white and fine
A perfect piece of poultry, a lunch I thought divine.

(Chorus)
But a bone I didn't see, it lodged itself inside of me
A sudden, silent panic, where the Potomac meets the sea
Gasping at the seagulls, clutching at my throat
A final, frantic gurgle on my memorial bank note
Oh, the irony's as thick as that unholy chunk
To be slain by my own lunch, on the river, sunk.

(Verse 2)
The world turned shades of purple, the Washington Monument
Did a wobbly, slow-motion spin above the element
I saw old Honest Abe look down from his great marble chair
With a look of deep concern and a stone-etched, stony stare
The Kennedy Center whispered, the cherry blossoms sighed
As the flavor of buttermilk batter stuck deep inside.

(Chorus)
And that bone I didn't see, it lodged itself inside of me
A sudden, silent panic, where the Potomac meets the sea
Gasping at the seagulls, clutching at my throat
A final, frantic gurgle on my memorial bank note
Oh, the irony's as thick as that unholy chunk
To be slain by my own lunch, on the river, sunk.

(Bridge)
No grand conspiracy, no spy from some dark shore
Just a careless, hungry moment, and I ain't hungry anymore
My life did not flash by, no, it was simpler, I confess
I just thought, "Of all the ways, this one is a mess."
To survive the city's dangers, the politics and fuss
And be taken out by supper on a riverboat's faint buzz.

(Chorus)
Yeah, that bone I didn't see, it lodged itself inside of me
A sudden, silent panic, where the Potamac meets the sea
Gasping at the seagulls, clutching at my throat
A final, frantic gurgle on my memorial bank note
Oh, the irony's as thick as that unholy chunk
To be slain by my own lunch, on the river, sunk.

(Outro)
The catfish, they will wonder at the strange and savory ghost
That joins the silt and history on this famous Eastern coast
A monument to hurry, and to chewing well, they'll say
Who drowned not in the water, but in his own lunch that day...
Just a piece of chicken... on the Potomac.

original_prompt: Write a 300+ word summary of the wikipedia page "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Raymond_III,_Count_of_Tripoli". Do not use any commas and highlight at least 3 sections that has titles in markdown format, for example *highlighted section part 1*, *highlighted section part 2*, *highlighted section part 3*.
response:
Raymond III was the Count of Tripoli from 1152 until his death in 1187 He was a major figure in the Kingdom of Jerusalem during a period of intense conflict with the Muslim forces led by Saladin Raymond was the son of Count Raymond II of Tripoli and his wife Hodierna of Jerusalem He became count at a young age after his father was assassinated by the Assassins Because he was a minor his mother Hodierna acted as regent until she returned to Jerusalem At that point King Baldwin III of Jerusalem who was Raymonds cousin took over the regency for the young count

*Early captivity*
In 1161 Raymond was captured by the Muslim ruler Nur ad-Din while on a plundering raid He spent the next ten years as a prisoner in Aleppo This long captivity was a significant event that shaped his later policies and his cautious attitude toward military confrontation with the Muslims He was released in 1172 only after a large ransom was paid possibly with help from the Byzantine Emperor Manuel I Komnenos Following his release he immediately traveled to Constantinople to give thanks.

*Regent of Jerusalem*
Raymonds role expanded greatly in 1174 He was named regent for the young King Baldwin IV who was a leper and also became the *bailli* or administrator of the kingdom During his regency he negotiated a truce with Saladin which provided a period of relative peace for the kingdom He also led a military campaign into Syria His regency was marked by a pragmatic and often cautious approach to foreign policy He was a proponent of maintaining treaties with the Muslim forces to preserve the fragile kingdom However his regency ended in 1176 when Baldwin IV came of age.

*Battle of Hattin and death*
The final years of Raymonds life were dominated by the great crisis of the kingdom He was a leader of the faction that advocated caution against Saladin This was in opposition to the aggressive party led by Guy of Lusignan In 1187 when Saladin invaded Raymond reluctantly agreed to support Guy and gathered his forces with the royal army The subsequent Battle of Hattin was a catastrophic defeat for the Crusaders Raymond was one of the few Christian leaders to escape the initial encirclement He managed to break through the Muslim lines with a charge but he died soon after reportedly of a broken heart from the loss of his city and the destruction of the kingdom Count Raymond III of Tripoli died in Tripoli just months after the battle leaving no legitimate heirs and his county passed to his godson Raymond IV of Antioch.

To Tokyo's great heart thou shalt straight fly

Thou climbest Fuji-san its peak so white

In Nara park the sacred deer bow low

Then homeward bound thy weary feet shall turn
With memories bright thy loyal heart shall yearn.

THIS SENTENCE PRESENTS A MORAL DECLARATION THAT IS SIMULTANEOUSLY BOLD AND DANGEROUSLY OVERSIMPLIFIED. IT IS BOLD BECAUSE IT CHAMPIONS INDIVIDUAL CONSCIENCE OVER BLIND OBEDIENCE TO AUTHORITY, A PRINCIPLE THAT HAS HISTORICALLY FUELED IMPORTANT SOCIAL MOVEMENTS LIKE CIVIL DISOBEDIENCE. HOWEVER, IT IS DANGEROUSLY OVERSIMPLIFIED BECAUSE IT PROVIDES NO FRAMEWORK FOR JUDGING A LAW'S "BADNESS," NOR DOES IT ADDRESS THE CONSEQUENCES OF NON-COMPLIANCE. PARAGRAPH 2
THE PRIMARY CRITIQUE OF THIS SENTENCE IS ITS FAILURE TO DISTINGUISH BETWEEN THE ACT OF PROTEST AND THE ACT OF SIMPLE DISOBEDIENCE. IT PROMOTES A FORM OF ANARCHY WHERE INDIVIDUAL JUDGMENT SUPERSEDES ALL COLLECTIVE GOVERNANCE, WITHOUT ACKNOWLEDGING THE CHAOS THAT WOULD RESULT IF EVERY CITIZEN ACTED AS THE SOLE ARBITER OF WHICH LAWS TO OBEY.

original_prompt: Write a long email template that invites a group of participants to a meeting, with at least 500 words. The email must include the keywords "correlated" and "experiencing" and should not use any commas.
response:
Subject: Invitation to a Vital Meeting Regarding Our Current Project Trajectory

Dear Team

I hope this message finds you well. I am writing to you today to extend a formal and enthusiastic invitation to an important upcoming meeting. This gathering is crucial for our continued progress and success. We have reached a pivotal juncture in our project timeline. The insights we gather and the decisions we make will directly shape our path forward. Your presence and active participation are not just requested they are essential.

Recently our data analysis team has been diligently reviewing performance metrics. Their preliminary findings suggest a significant development. Several key performance indicators appear to be strongly correlated with user engagement levels. This discovery is both profound and actionable. Understanding this correlation is fundamental to refining our strategy. We must delve deep into these relationships to unlock their full potential. Our discussion will center on interpreting these data points. We need to collectively determine what these correlations mean for our product's future. Your expertise will be invaluable in this process.

Furthermore we have been gathering feedback from our user base. Many are experiencing challenges with the new interface. It is clear that a subset of users is experiencing friction during the onboarding process. Others are experiencing confusion with certain advanced features. We cannot ignore these firsthand accounts. Their experiences are our most valuable source of truth. We need to understand why users are experiencing these difficulties. We must then brainstorm effective and elegant solutions. Your frontline perspective will help us empathize with our users and design a better product for them.

The primary objective of this meeting will be to synthesize these two streams of information. We will explore how the data trends are correlated with the user feedback. We will ask ourselves if the data confirms what our users are experiencing. We will then work together to formulate a cohesive and effective action plan. Our goal is to align our data-driven insights with the real-world problems our users are experiencing. This synergy is the key to our next breakthrough.

To facilitate a productive session I have outlined a preliminary agenda below

1.  A comprehensive presentation of the latest data analysis focusing on the correlated metrics.
2.  An open forum for sharing user feedback particularly the issues they are experiencing.
3.  A collaborative workshop to brainstorm solutions and strategic pivots.
4.  The establishment of clear next steps and the assignment of actionable tasks.

Please come prepared to share your thoughts and ideas. We encourage you to bring any relevant notes or data from your own departments. The success of this meeting hinges on a vibrant and open exchange of perspectives.

We have scheduled the meeting for Tuesday November 28th at 10:00 AM. It will be held in the main conference room on the third floor. We anticipate the session will last approximately two hours. Lunch will be provided immediately following the meeting as a small token of our appreciation for your valuable time and dedication.

Please confirm your attendance by the end of this week. This will help us finalize the logistics and ensure we have adequate seating and materials for everyone. If you have any pressing questions or specific topics you feel must be addressed please do not hesitate to reach out to me directly.

I am genuinely looking forward to our conversation. I am confident that by pooling our collective intelligence and focusing on these critical areas we can overcome these hurdles. Together we can transform these challenges into opportunities for growth and innovation. Your contribution is a vital piece of this puzzle. Thank you for your commitment to excellence.

Best regards

[Your Name]
[Your Title]

original_prompt: Write a blog post with 400 or more words about the benefits of sleeping in a hammock.
response:
Of course! Here is a blog post about the benefits of sleeping in a hammock.

***

### Swaying into Slumber: The Surprising Benefits of Sleeping in a Hammock

For centuries, hammocks have been synonymous with lazy summer afternoons, tropical vacations, and leisurely naps in the backyard. They evoke a sense of relaxation and simplicity. But what if this ancient invention was more than just a fair-weather lounging spot? What if a hammock could be your key to a deeper, more restorative night's sleep? It’s time to reconsider the hammock, not just as a patio accessory, but as a serious sleep system with a host of science-backed benefits.

#### 1. A Deeper, More Restorative Sleep

One of the most celebrated advantages of hammock sleeping is its ability to promote faster sleep onset and deeper sleep stages. A renowned study from the University of Geneva found that the gentle, rocking motion of a hammock has a profound impact on the brain. This rocking synchronizes brain waves, specifically enhancing the power of sleep spindles and slow-wave oscillations. These are the brain rhythms associated with deep, stable sleep and memory consolidation. In short, the rocking doesn't just lull you to sleep; it actively improves the *quality* of your sleep, helping you wake up feeling more refreshed.

#### 2. Superior Spinal Alignment and Pressure Relief

Many people struggle to find a mattress that offers the right balance of support and comfort. A hammock, surprisingly, solves this problem elegantly. When you lie diagonally in a gathered-end hammock, it cradles your body in a natural, ergonomic curve. This position provides exceptional support for your spine, helping to maintain its natural "S" shape and alleviating pressure points on your hips, shoulders, and back. Unlike a firm surface that pushes against your body, a hammock distributes your weight evenly, making it an excellent choice for those suffering from back pain.

#### 3. The Ultimate Relief for Sleepers with Back Pain

Following from the point above, the relief hammocks can provide for chronic back pain is significant. The combination of zero-pressure points and gentle, suspended support can reduce strain on the spine and surrounding muscles. Many individuals who suffer from conditions like sciatica or herniated discs report a marked reduction in pain after switching to a hammock. Of course, it's always best to consult with a healthcare professional, but for many, the hammock offers a drug-free path to more comfortable nights.

#### 4. Improved Circulation and Breathing

Sleeping flat on a traditional mattress can sometimes restrict circulation. The slightly elevated position of a hammock can be beneficial. Many people find that their breathing is easier and their circulation improved when their head and upper body are gently raised. This can be particularly helpful for individuals with mild sleep apnea or acid reflux, as the angle can help keep airways open and prevent stomach acid from rising.

#### 5. A Natural Environment for Meditation and Relaxation

Even before you fall asleep, a hammock provides a sanctuary for unwinding. The gentle swaying motion is inherently calming, mimicking the soothing rocking we experience as infants. This can lower cortisol levels (the stress hormone) and ease anxiety. Spending just 20 minutes reading or simply breathing in a hammock after a long day can serve as a powerful form of active rest, preparing your mind and body for a peaceful night.

#### Ready to Make the Switch? Tips for Hammock Sleeping

Convinced? Before you ditch your bed frame, here are a few tips for a successful transition:

*   **Sleep on the Diagonal:** Don't lie straight in a gathered-end hammock, as this will create a banana-like curve that is bad for your back. Instead, lie at a roughly 30-degree angle. This will allow your body to lie almost flat.
*   **Invest in a Quality Hammock:** Choose a hammock made from a soft, breathable fabric like cotton or a specialized parachute nylon. Ensure it's wide and long enough for you to comfortably lie diagonally.
*   **Use a Stand or Secure Mounting:** Whether indoors or out, your hammock needs a stable foundation. A sturdy stand offers flexibility, while secure wall or ceiling mounts (using proper hardware!) provide a permanent sleep solution.
*   **Consider the Climate:** Hammocks can be cooler than beds due to increased air circulation. For indoor use, you can use a standard set of sheets and blankets. For outdoor camping, an under-quilt is essential for insulation.

The humble hammock is much more than a piece of leisure equipment. It's a tool for enhancing one of the most fundamental aspects of our health: sleep. By offering a unique combination of gentle motion, ergonomic support, and a cocoon-like sense of security, it just might be the upgrade your sleep routine has been waiting for. So, why not give it a swing? Your best night's sleep might just be waiting for you, suspended in the air.

response:
Mark’s morning began with a pixelated sunbeam slicing through the blinds, its edges unnaturally sharp. He blinked, expecting the effect to fade, but instead, the floral pattern on his duvet remained a low-resolution blur. When he swung his legs out of bed, his foot clipped the nightstand with a hollow, wooden *thunk* that sounded exactly like the sound effect from a dozen fantasy games. Suspicion curdled into certainty as he stared at his own hands, noticing that his fingers moved in slightly jerky, predefined animations. His heart hammered against his ribs, a rhythmic, repeating beat that was less a biological function and more a pre-recorded audio loop.

***

Determined to test his theory, Mark left his apartment and walked into a city that operated on a now-obvious logic. Pedestrians on the sidewalk followed strict, looping paths, occasionally getting stuck on lampposts before resetting with a slight jitter. He approached a hot dog vendor, whose only response to any query was a cheerful, "Need something?" When Mark deliberately stepped off the curb into traffic, a towering delivery truck screeched to a halt an inch from his face, its wheels frozen mid-skid. A shimmering, translucent "COLLISION AVERTED" message flickered briefly in the air before dissolving. He was undeniably a player, not a person, and the world was his cage, its rules both a prison and a bizarre, newfound safety net.

original_prompt: Write a short blog post about a trip to Japan using less than 300 words.
response:
**A Glimpse of Japan**

Stepping out of the orderly chaos of Shinjuku Station, I was hit by a wave of humid air and neon light. My trip to Japan was a whirlwind of sensory contrasts.

I spent mornings in serene silence, wandering through ancient temples in Kyoto. The scent of incense hung heavy, and the only sound was the crunch of gravel underfoot. Then, I’d jump on a bullet train, hurtling past a blur of Mount Fuji, and land in the electric buzz of Tokyo by afternoon.

The food was an adventure in itself. I perfected the art of slurping rich ramen in a tiny, steamy shop and indulged in impossibly fresh sushi from a Tsukiji vendor with a kind smile. Each meal was a small, perfect ceremony.

My most cherished memory? An evening in a quiet Kyoto garden, watching a single red leaf drift onto a still pond. It was a moment of profound peace that seemed to capture the soul of this incredible country—a perfect harmony of past and future, chaos and calm.

Japan left me with a full heart and a camera roll bursting with contrasts. It’s a place I’ll long to return to.

original_prompt: Write a poem about how I am missing my classes. The poem must have 4 sections marked with SECTION X. Finish the poem with this exact phrase: "Can I get my money back for the classes I missed?"
response:
SECTION 1
My chair is empty, a hollow throne,
The syllabus, a text I've never known.
The morning lecture's distant hum,
Has quietly, and finally, come.
The window shows a changing sky,
While links to class go blinking by.

SECTION 2
I miss the scratch of hurried pens,
The shared, tired sighs at quarter-to-ten.
The whispered jokes, the professor's glare,
The heavy weight of the lecture-hall air.
The coffee steam, the rustling page,
A turning in my learning's stage.

SECTION 3
The screen stays dark, the mic's on mute,
Replaced by silence, absolute.
Group projects stall in muted chats,
Replaced by solitary stats.
A digital and lonely sphere,
Where motivation disappears.

SECTION 4
The knowledge pool I meant to drink,
Is standing at the river's brink.
Each absent day, a widening gap,
A poorly folded, crumpled map.
The semester's yield will be less,
A harvest born from emptiness.

Can I get my money back for the classes I missed?

kwargs.end_phrase: Can I get my money back for the classes I missed?

response:
ਤੁਹਾਨੂੰ ਸਾਫਟਵੇਅਰ ਇੰਜੀਨੀਅਰ ਦੇ ਤਕਨੀਕੀ ਹੁਨਰਾਂ ਦੇ ਮੁਲਾਂਕਣ ਲਈ ਇੱਕ ਰੂਬਰਿਕ ਬਣਾਉਣੀ ਹੈ। ਇਸ ਰੂਬਰਿਕ ਵਿੱਚ ਸਿਰਫ਼ ਪੰਜਾਬੀ ਭਾਸ਼ਾ ਦੀ ਵਰਤੋਂ ਕਰਨੀ ਹੈ। ਹੇਠਾਂ ਲਿਖਿਆ ਰੂਬਰਿਕ ਪੇਸ਼ ਹੈ:

---

### **ਸਾਫਟਵੇਅਰ ਇੰਜੀਨੀਅਰ ਦੇ ਤਕਨੀਕੀ ਹੁਨਰਾਂ ਦਾ ਮੁਲਾਂਕਣ ਰੂਬਰਿਕ**

**ਮੁਲਾਂਕਣ ਦੇ ਖੇਤਰ:** ਪ੍ਰੋਗਰਾਮਿੰਗ ਭਾਸ਼ਾਵਾਂ
- **4 (ਮਾਸਟਰ):** ਕੋਡ ਸਪੱਸ਼ਟ, ਕਾਰਗੁਜ਼ਾਰ, ਅਤੇ ਰੱਖ-ਰਖਾਵ ਯੋਗ ਲਿਖਦਾ ਹੈ। ਕਈ ਪ੍ਰੋਗਰਾਮਿੰਗ ਭਾਸ਼ਾਵਾਂ ਵਿੱਚ ਮੁਹਾਰਤ ਰੱਖਦਾ ਹੈ ਅਤੇ ਭਾਸ਼ਾ ਦੀਆਂ ਉੱਚ-ਪੱਧਰੀ ਵਿਸ਼ੇਸ਼ਤਾਵਾਂ ਦਾ ਪ੍ਰਭਾਵਸ਼ਾਲੀ ਢੰਗ ਨਾਲ ਇਸਤੇਮਾਲ ਕਰਦਾ ਹੈ।
- **3 (ਕੁਸ਼ਲ):** ਕੋਡ ਕੁਸ਼ਲ ਅਤੇ ਠੀਕ ਢੰਗ ਨਾਲ ਢਾਂਚਾਗਤ ਹੁੰਦਾ ਹੈ। ਭਾਸ਼ਾ ਦੀਆਂ ਮੁੱਢਲੀਆਂ ਅਤੇ ਮੱਧਮ ਪੱਧਰ ਦੀਆਂ ਵਿਸ਼ੇਸ਼ਤਾਵਾਂ ਦੀ ਚੰਗੀ ਸਮਝ ਰੱਖਦਾ ਹੈ।
- **2 (ਸਿਖਲਾਈ ਪ੍ਰਾਪਤ):** ਮੁੱਢਲੀਆਂ ਵਿਸ਼ੇਸ਼ਤਾਵਾਂ ਦੀ ਸਮਝ ਹੈ ਪਰ ਗਹਿਰੀ ਜਾਣਕਾਰੀ ਦੀ ਕਮੀ ਹੈ। ਕੋਡ ਵਿੱਚ ਕੁਝ ਗਲਤੀਆਂ ਹੋ ਸਕਦੀਆਂ ਹਨ ਅਤੇ ਉਹ ਉੱਚ-ਪੱਧਰੀ ਵਿਸ਼ੇਸ਼ਤਾਵਾਂ ਦਾ ਇਸਤੇਮਾਲ ਨਹੀਂ ਕਰਦਾ।
- **1 (ਸ਼ੁਰੂਆਤੀ):** ਪ੍ਰੋਗਰਾਮਿੰਗ ਭਾਸ਼ਾ ਦੀਆਂ ਮੁੱਢਲੀਆਂ ਧਾਰਨਾਵਾਂ ਦੀ ਸੀਮਿਤ ਸਮਝ ਹੈ। ਕੋਡ ਵਿੱਚ ਗਲਤੀਆਂ ਹਨ ਅਤੇ ਉਹ ਪੜ੍ਹਨ ਜਾਂ ਸਮਝਣ ਵਿੱਚ ਮੁਸ਼ਕਲ ਹੈ।

**ਮੁਲਾਂਕਣ ਦੇ ਖੇਤਰ:** ਡੇਟਾ ਬਣਤਰਾਂ ਅਤੇ ਐਲਗੋਰਿਥਮ
- **4 (ਮਾਸਟਰ):** ਡੇਟਾ ਬਣਤਰਾਂ ਅਤੇ ਐਲਗੋਰਿਥਮ ਦੀ ਡੂੰਘੀ ਸਮਝ ਹੈ। ਸਮੇਂ ਅਤੇ ਜਗ੍ਹਾ ਦੀ ਜਟਿਲਤਾ ਦਾ ਵਿਸ਼ਲੇਸ਼ਣ ਕਰ ਸਕਦਾ ਹੈ ਅਤੇ ਹਲ ਲਈ ਸਹੀ ਢਾਂਚੇ ਦੀ ਪਛਾਣ ਕਰ ਸਕਦਾ ਹੈ।
- **3 (ਕੁਸ਼ਲ):** ਆਮ ਡੇਟਾ ਬਣਤਰਾਂ ਅਤੇ ਐਲਗੋਰਿਥਮ ਦੀ ਚੰਗੀ ਸਮਝ ਹੈ। ਜ਼ਿਆਦਾਤਰ ਸਮੱਸਿਆਵਾਂ ਲਈ ਢੁਕਵਾਂ ਢਾਂਚਾ ਚੁਣ ਸਕਦਾ ਹੈ।
- **2 (ਸਿਖਲਾਈ ਪ੍ਰਾਪਤ):** ਮੁੱਢਲੀਆਂ ਡੇਟਾ ਬਣਤਰਾਂ ਦੀ ਸਮਝ ਹੈ ਪਰ ਉਹਨਾਂ ਨੂੰ ਲਾਗੂ ਕਰਨ ਵਿੱਚ ਮੁਸ਼ਕਲਾਂ ਆਉਂਦੀਆਂ ਹਨ। ਜਟਿਲ ਸਮੱਸਿਆਵਾਂ ਲਈ ਢੁਕਵਾਂ ਢਾਂਚਾ ਚੁਣਨ ਵਿੱਚ ਸੰਘਰਸ਼ ਕਰਦਾ ਹੈ।
- **1 (ਸ਼ੁਰੂਆਤੀ):** ਡੇਟਾ ਬਣਤਰਾਂ ਦੀ ਬਹੁਤ ਘੱਟ ਜਾਣਕਾਰੀ ਹੈ। ਸਿਰਫ਼ ਬਹੁਤ ਹੀ ਆਸਾਨ ਸਮੱਸਿਆਵਾਂ ਨੂੰ ਹੀ ਹੱਲ ਕਰ ਸਕਦਾ ਹੈ।

**ਮੁਲਾਂਕਣ ਦੇ ਖੇਤਰ:** ਸਾਫਟਵੇਅਰ ਡਿਜ਼ਾਈਨ ਅਤੇ ਆਰਕੀਟੈਕਚਰ
- **4 (ਮਾਸਟਰ):** ਉੱਚ-ਗੁਣਵੱਤਾ ਵਾਲੀਆਂ ਡਿਜ਼ਾਈਨ ਪਦਧਤੀਆਂ (ਜਿਵੇਂ SOA, ਮਾਈਕ੍ਰੋਸਰਵਿਸਿਜ਼) ਦੀ ਡੂੰਘੀ ਸਮਝ ਹੈ। ਮਾਡਯੂਲਰ, ਮਾਪਣਯੋਗ, ਅਤੇ ਰੱਖ-ਰਖਾਵ ਯੋਗ ਸਿਸਟਮ ਡਿਜ਼ਾਈਨ ਕਰ ਸਕਦਾ ਹੈ।
- **3 (ਕੁਸ਼ਲ):** ਡਿਜ਼ਾਈਨ ਪੈਟਰਨ (ਜਿਵੇਂ MVC, ਰਿਪੋਜ਼ਿਟਰੀ) ਦੀ ਸਮਝ ਹੈ। ਠੋਸ ਢਾਂਚੇ ਵਾਲੇ ਸਿਸਟਮ ਡਿਜ਼ਾਈਨ ਕਰ ਸਕਦਾ ਹੈ ਪਰ ਉੱਚ-ਪੱਧਰੀ ਆਰਕੀਟੈਕਚਰਲ ਫੈਸਲੇ ਲੈਣ ਵਿੱਚ ਮਦਦ ਦੀ ਲੋੜ ਪੈ ਸਕਦੀ ਹੈ।
- **2 (ਸਿਖਲਾਈ ਪ੍ਰਾਪਤ):** ਡਿਜ਼ਾਈਨ ਪੈਟਰਨ ਦੀ ਮੁੱਢਲੀ ਸਮਝ ਹੈ। ਸਾਧਾਰਨ ਕੰਪੋਨੈਂਟ ਡਿਜ਼ਾਈਨ ਕਰ ਸਕਦਾ ਹੈ ਪਰ ਪੂਰੇ ਸਿਸਟਮ ਦਾ ਆਰਕੀਟੈਕਚਰ ਡਿਜ਼ਾਈਨ ਨਹੀਂ ਕਰ ਸਕਦਾ।
- **1 (ਸ਼ੁਰੂਆਤੀ):** ਡਿਜ਼ਾਈਨ ਦੀਆਂ ਧਾਰਨਾਵਾਂ ਬਾਰੇ ਬਹੁਤ ਘੱਟ ਜਾਣਕਾਰੀ ਹੈ। ਇੱਕਲੇ ਫੰਕਸ਼ਨ ਜਾਂ ਕਲਾਸ ਤੋਂ ਉੱਪਰ ਡਿਜ਼ਾਈਨ ਨਹੀਂ ਕਰ ਸਕਦਾ।

**ਮੁਲਾਂਕਣ ਦੇ ਖੇਤਰ:** ਡਾਟਾਬੇਸ ਅਤੇ ਕੈਸ਼ਿੰਗ
- **4 (ਮਾਸਟਰ):** ਰਿਲੇਸ਼ਨਲ ਅਤੇ ਨੋ-ਐਸਕਿਊਐਲ ਡਾਟਾਬੇਸ ਦੀ ਡੂੰਘੀ ਸਮਝ ਹੈ। ਪ੍ਰਦਰਸ਼ਨ ਲਈ ਡਾਟਾਬੇਸ ਨੂੰ ਟਿਊਨ ਕਰ ਸਕਦਾ ਹੈ ਅਤੇ ਕੈਸ਼ਿੰਗ ਰਣਨੀਤੀਆਂ ਨੂੰ ਲਾਗੂ ਕਰ ਸਕਦਾ ਹੈ।
- **3 (ਕੁਸ਼ਲ):** ਡਾਟਾਬੇਸ ਸਕੀਮਾ ਡਿਜ਼ਾਈਨ ਕਰ ਸਕਦਾ ਹੈ ਅਤੇ ਐਸਕਿਊਐਲ ਲਿਖ ਸਕਦਾ ਹੈ। ਕੈਸ਼ਿੰਗ ਦੀਆਂ ਮੁੱਢਲੀਆਂ ਧਾਰਨਾਵਾਂ ਨੂੰ ਸਮਝਦਾ ਹੈ।
- **2 (ਸਿਖਲਾਈ ਪ੍ਰਾਪਤ):** ਸਧਾਰਨ ਐਸਕਿਊਐਲ ਕੁਵਰੀਜ਼ ਲਿਖ ਸਕਦਾ ਹੈ ਪਰ ਡਾਟਾਬੇਸ ਡਿਜ਼ਾਈਨ ਵਿੱਚ ਮਦਦ ਦੀ ਲੋੜ ਹੈ। ਕੈਸ਼ਿੰਗ ਬਾਰੇ ਬਹੁਤ ਘੱਟ ਜਾਣਕਾਰੀ ਹੈ।
- **1 (ਸ਼ੁਰੂਆਤੀ):** ਡਾਟਾਬੇਸ ਬਾਰੇ ਬਹੁਤ ਘੱਟ ਜਾਣਕਾਰੀ ਹੈ। ਬਹੁਤ ਹੀ ਆਸਾਨ ਐਸਕਿਊਐਲ ਕੁਵਰੀਜ਼ ਵੀ ਗਲਤ ਲਿਖ ਸਕਦਾ ਹੈ।

**ਮੁਲਾਂਕਣ ਦੇ ਖੇਤਰ:** ਨੈੱਟਵਰਕਿੰਗ ਅਤੇ ਵੈੱਬ ਸੇਵਾਵਾਂ
- **4 (ਮਾਸਟਰ):** HTTP, REST API, ਅਤੇ ਨੈੱਟਵਰਕ ਪ੍ਰੋਟੋਕੋਲ ਦੀ ਡੂੰਘੀ ਸਮਝ ਹੈ। ਸੁਰੱਖਿਅਤ ਅਤੇ ਮਾਪਣਯੋਗ ਵੈੱਬ ਸੇਵਾਵਾਂ ਡਿਜ਼ਾਈਨ ਅਤੇ ਲਾਗੂ ਕਰ ਸਕਦਾ ਹੈ।
- **3 (ਕੁਸ਼ਲ):** REST API ਬਣਾ ਸਕਦਾ ਹੈ ਅਤੇ ਉਸਦੀ ਵਰਤੋਂ ਕਰ ਸਕਦਾ ਹੈ। HTTP ਦੀਆਂ ਮੁੱਢਲੀਆਂ ਧਾਰਨਾਵਾਂ ਨੂੰ ਸਮਝਦਾ ਹੈ।
- **2 (ਸਿਖਲਾਈ ਪ੍ਰਾਪਤ):** ਸਿਰਫ਼ ਮੁੱਢਲੇ ਨੈੱਟਵਰਕਿੰਗ ਸੰਕਲਪਾਂ ਨੂੰ ਸਮਝਦਾ ਹੈ। ਪਹਿਲਾਂ ਤੋਂ ਮੌਜੂਦ API ਨੂੰ ਵਰਤ ਸਕਦਾ ਹੈ ਪਰ ਨਵੀਂ API ਡਿਜ਼ਾਈਨ ਕਰਨ ਵਿੱਚ ਮੁਸ਼ਕਲ ਹੁੰਦੀ ਹੈ।
- **1 (ਸ਼ੁਰੂਆਤੀ):** ਨੈੱਟਵਰਕਿੰਗ ਬਾਰੇ ਬਹੁਤ ਘੱਟ ਜਾਣਕਾਰੀ ਹੈ। ਵੈੱਬ ਸੇਵਾਵਾਂ ਬਾਰੇ ਸਮਝ ਨਹੀਂ ਹੈ।

**ਮੁਲਾਂਕਣ ਦੇ ਖੇਤਰ:** ਟੈਸਟਿੰਗ ਅਤੇ ਡੀਬੱਗਿੰਗ
- **4 (ਮਾਸਟਰ):** ਯੂਨਿਟ ਟੈਸਟ, ਇੰਟੀਗ੍ਰੇਸ਼ਨ ਟੈਸਟ, ਅਤੇ ਆਟੋਮੇਟਡ ਟੈਸਟਿੰਗ ਫਰੇਮਵਰਕ ਦੀ ਡੂੰਘੀ ਸਮਝ ਹੈ। ਟੈਸਟ ਸੂਟ ਬਣਾ ਸਕਦਾ ਹੈ ਅਤੇ ਗਹਿਰੀਆਂ ਸਮੱਸਿਆਵਾਂ ਨੂੰ ਡੀਬੱਗ ਕਰ ਸਕਦਾ ਹੈ।
- **3 (ਕੁਸ਼ਲ):** ਯੂਨਿਟ ਟੈਸਟ ਲਿਖ ਸਕਦਾ ਹੈ ਅਤੇ ਸਧਾਰਨ ਸਮੱਸਿਆਵਾਂ ਨੂੰ ਡੀਬੱਗ ਕਰ ਸਕਦਾ ਹੈ। ਟੈਸਟਿੰਗ ਦੀਆਂ ਮੁੱਢਲੀਆਂ ਧਾਰਨਾਵਾਂ ਦੀ ਸਮਝ ਹੈ।
- **2 (ਸਿਖਲਾਈ ਪ੍ਰਾਪਤ):** ਟੈਸਟ ਕੇਸ ਲਿਖ ਸਕਦਾ ਹੈ ਪਰ ਉਹਨਾਂ ਦੀ ਗੁਣਵੱਤਾ ਘੱਟ ਹੈ। ਡੀਬੱਗਰ ਦੀ ਵਰਤੋਂ ਕਰਨੀ ਸਿੱਖ ਰਿਹਾ ਹੈ।
- **1 (ਸ਼ੁਰੂਆਤੀ):** ਟੈਸਟਿੰਗ ਬਾਰੇ ਬਹੁਤ ਘੱਟ ਜਾਣਕਾਰੀ ਹੈ। ਸਮੱਸਿਆਵਾਂ ਨੂੰ ਡੀਬੱਗ ਕਰਨ ਵਿੱਚ ਮੁਸ਼ਕਲ ਹੁੰਦੀ ਹੈ।

**ਮੁਲਾਂਕਣ ਦੇ ਖੇਤਰ:** ਵਰਜਨ ਨਿਯੰਤਰਣ (ਜਿਵੇਂ Git)
- **4 (ਮਾਸਟਰ):** Git ਦੇ ਉੱਚ-ਪੱਧਰੀ ਕਮਾਂਡਾਂ ਅਤੇ ਵਰਕਫਲੋਜ਼ (ਜਿਵੇਂ rebase, cherry-pick) ਦੀ ਮਾਹਿਰ-ਪੱਧਰੀ ਸਮਝ ਹੈ। ਟੀਮ ਲਈ ਵਰਜਨ ਨਿਯੰਤਰਣ ਰਣਨੀਤੀਆਂ ਬਣਾ ਸਕਦਾ ਹੈ।
- **3 (ਕੁਸ਼ਲ):** Git ਦੀਆਂ ਮੁੱਢਲੀਆਂ ਕਮਾਂਡਾਂ (commit, push, pull, branch) ਦੀ ਵਰਤੋਂ ਕਰ ਸਕਦਾ ਹੈ। ਮਰਜ ਕਰਵਾਉਣ ਦੇ ਟਕਰਾਅ ਨੂੰ ਹੱਲ ਕਰ ਸਕਦਾ ਹੈ।
- **2 (ਸਿਖਲਾਈ ਪ੍ਰਾਪਤ):** ਮੁੱਢਲੀਆਂ ਕਮਾਂਡਾਂ ਨੂੰ ਸਮਝਦਾ ਹੈ ਪਰ ਟਕਰਾਅ ਹੱਲ ਕਰਨ ਵਿੱਚ ਮੁਸ਼ਕਲ ਹੁੰਦੀ ਹੈ। ਵਿਸ਼ੇਸ਼ ਵਰਕਫਲੋਜ਼ ਦੀ ਸਮਝ ਨਹੀਂ ਹੈ।
- **1 (ਸ਼ੁਰੂਆਤੀ):** ਵਰਜਨ ਨਿਯੰਤਰਣ ਬਾਰੇ ਬਹੁਤ ਘੱਟ ਜਾਣਕਾਰੀ ਹੈ। ਮੁੱਢਲੀਆਂ ਕਮਾਂਡਾਂ ਦੀ ਵੀ ਵਰਤੋਂ ਨਹੀਂ ਕਰ ਸਕਦਾ।

---
**ਕੁੱਲ ਸਕੋਰ:** 28 ਪੁਆਇੰਟ ਸੰਭਵ ਹਨ। ਇੱਕ ਇੰਜੀਨੀਅਰ ਦਾ ਕੁੱਲ ਸਕੋਰ ਸਾਰੇ ਖੇਤਰਾਂ ਦੇ ਸਕੋਰ ਨੂੰ ਜੋੜ ਕੇ ਪਤਾ ਲੱਗੇਗਾ। ਇਸ ਰੂਬਰਿਕ ਦੀ ਵਰਤੋਂ ਕਰਕੇ, ਮੁਲਾਂਕਣ ਕਰਨ ਵਾਲਾ ਇੰਜੀਨੀਅਰ ਦੇ ਤਕਨੀਕੀ ਹੁਨਰਾਂ ਦਾ ਸਪੱਸ਼ٹ ਚਿੱਤਰ ਪ੍ਰਾਪਤ ਕਰ ਸਕਦਾ ਹੈ।

original_prompt: Explain why people are grossed out by worms but not by eating a dead cow. Give exactly two different responses separated by 6 asterisk symbols ******. Your answer must contain a title, wrapped in double angular brackets, i.e. <<title>>.
response:
<<The Disgust Dichotomy: Worms vs. Steak>>

1.  **Cultural Conditioning and Food Symbolism:** A primary reason lies in deeply ingrained cultural conditioning. In many Western societies, cows are culturally established as a legitimate food source. They are raised on farms, butchered in a way that distances the consumer from the animal's living form, and presented as sterile, packaged cuts like "steak" or "burger." This process sanitizes the concept of eating a dead animal. Worms, conversely, are culturally coded as symbols of decay, filth, and disease. They are associated with rot, garbage, and death in its most untreated form. We are taught from a young age that things worms consume are "gross," and by extension, the worms themselves become gross. Eating a worm feels like consuming decay itself, while eating a cow is framed as consuming nourishment.

******

2.  **Sensory and Biological Associations:** The disgust response is also triggered by specific sensory and biological cues. Worms are often encountered in contexts that trigger our instinctual aversion to pathogens—in dirt, on rotting food, or after rain. Their slimy, squirming texture is highly alien and triggers a visceral recoil related to a fear of parasites and contamination. A cooked steak, however, engages different senses: it smells pleasant, has a firm and familiar texture, and appears clean and bloodless on a plate. Our brain does not immediately connect the cooked muscle tissue to a living, breathing animal or to the process of decay. The cooking process itself transforms it into something our senses recognize as "food," bypassing the disgust instincts that wriggling, soil-dwelling invertebrates instantly activate.

original_prompt: What happened when the Tang dynasty of China was in power? Make sure to use the word war at least 8 times, and the word peace at least 10 times.
response:
During the long era when the Tang dynasty was in power, the empire experienced a complex and dynamic interplay between **war** and **peace**. The initial consolidation of the realm under the early Tang emperors required a great deal of **war**, as rival factions vied for control in the aftermath of the Sui collapse. This period of intense **war**, however, ultimately paved the way for one of the most celebrated golden ages of Chinese civilization, an era of profound **peace**. Under emperors like Taizong and the later Empress Wu Zetian, the dynasty expanded its borders through calculated **war** along the Silk Road and into Central Asia, securing the frontiers to ensure lasting internal **peace**.

This age of unprecedented **peace** and prosperity, the "Glorious Age of Kaiyuan," fostered incredible cultural and economic flourishing. It was a **peace** built, paradoxically, on the successful prosecution of foreign **war**. The military campaigns, or **war**, against states like Goguryeo and the Western Turks were immensely expensive, but their success was intended to guarantee economic **peace** and stability along the vital trade routes. This internal **peace** allowed for the arts to thrive, legal codes to be perfected, and the capital, Chang'an, to become a cosmopolitan hub of global culture, a true testament to the fruits of **peace**.

However, this delicate balance could not be maintained forever. The devastating An Lushan Rebellion represented the most destructive internal **war** the dynasty would ever face. This brutal, protracted **war** shattered the long-enjoyed **peace**, plunging the empire into chaos for years. The central government's authority was fatally weakened. Despite the eventual suppression of the rebellion, the state of **peace** that followed was fragile and fragmented, a mere shadow of the former glorious **peace**.

The later Tang period was characterized by a continuous struggle to reclaim stability and **peace** in the face of centrifugal forces. Regional warlords, many of whom had gained power during the recent **war**, constantly challenged the court's authority, leading to sporadic, localized **war**. The central government, desperate to maintain a semblance of **peace**, often had to engage in political **war** with these powerful military governors. Ultimately, this protracted internal **war** of attrition eroded the dynasty's foundations. Thus, the Tang dynasty's narrative is a constant cycle: the pursuit of **peace** through the means of **war**, the flourishing of **peace** after victorious **war**, and the eventual collapse of **peace** back into chaotic **war**.

original_prompt: What sentiments existed in the Croatian and Serbian nations towards the Austrian Empire at the end of the 19th century? Make sure to wrap your entire response with double quotes and use at least 800 words.
response:
"In the final decades of the 19th century, the relationship between the Croatian and Serbian nations within the Kingdom of Croatia-Slavonia, an autonomous entity under the Hungarian Crown in the Austro-Hungarian Empire, was complex and marked by a profound duality. Their sentiments towards the Austrian Empire, specifically the Imperial court in Vienna, cannot be homogenized into a single narrative, as they were characterized by a volatile mixture of pragmatic loyalty, strategic hope, growing disillusionment, and nascent nationalist aspirations that often diverged between the two groups while occasionally converging.

The Croatian political elite, primarily represented by the People's Party under the leadership of Ante Starčević and the Party of Rights, held a deeply conflicted view of Vienna. The central tenet of Croatian politics of this era was the Triune Kingdom—the concept of a unified Croatia, Slavonia, and Dalmatia—as a historically legitimate political entity with a right to self-governance. For many, Vienna was seen as a counterweight to the more immediate and detested oppressor: Budapest. Following the *Nagodba* (Compromise) of 1868 between Croatia and Hungary, Croatian autonomy was consistently eroded by Hungarian attempts to enforce the Magyar language in administration and railways and to centralize power. Consequently, a significant strand of Croatian political thought, particularly before the 1880s, practiced a policy of 'monastic loyalty' to the Emperor. This was a strategic maneuver. They appealed directly to Franz Joseph, bypassing the Hungarian parliament, in the hope that the Crown, as the ultimate feudal sovereign, would honor historical state rights and protect Croatia from Hungarian encroachment. This was not an expression of love for the Empire, but a political calculation that Vienna was the lesser of two evils and a potential ally in their struggle for autonomy.

However, this sentiment of strategic loyalty was perpetually tested and often turned into bitter disappointment. Vienna, bound by the Austro-Hungarian Compromise of 1867, consistently sided with Budapest in crucial disputes to maintain the delicate equilibrium of the Dual Monarchy. Each failed appeal, each royal sanction given to Hungarian centralizing policies, chipped away at Croatian faith in the Emperor. The feelings that replaced it were frustration and a sense of historical betrayal. For nationalist ideologues like Starčević, the Habsburg monarchy was an illegitimate foreign ruler, and his Party of Rights openly advocated for an independent Croatian state. By the end of the century, this disillusionment had become widespread, fostering a more defiant nationalism that looked less to Vienna for salvation and more towards the possibilities of a South Slav (Yugoslav) solution, though this was still a minority view among the mainstream political class, which remained focused on autonomy within the Empire.

The sentiments of the Serbians in the same geographic space were, if anything, even more layered and complex. As a religious and ethnic minority with a kin-state (the independent Kingdom of Serbia) across the border, their relationship with Vienna was intrinsically different. The Serbian Orthodox population, led by an empowered political and ecclesiastical elite, possessed a distinct institutional structure through the Serbian Orthodox Church and its cultural and educational societies, such as *Prosvjeta* and *Matica srpska*. Initially, after the abolition of the Military Frontier in 1881, which brought a large Serbian population under civilian rule, there was a period of cautious cooperation with the Habsburg state. The Serbs saw the Empire as a guarantor of their religious and cultural rights against the Croatian majority's own nationalist ambitions, which sometimes sought to define the state in exclusively Croatian Catholic terms.

This led to a political alliance of convenience between the Serbian political leadership and the Hungarian government. Budapest, following a classic 'divide and rule' strategy, supported Serbian political demands as a way to check and weaken Croatian autonomist movements. Serbs were often overrepresented in certain administrative posts as a counterbalance to Croats. This dynamic created a sentiment among many Serbs that Vienna, and its proxy in Budapest, was a protector. However, this was a pragmatic, utilitarian loyalty, not a deep-seated dynastic patriotism. It was a means to secure communal rights and political influence within the imperfect system.

Simultaneously, a powerful undercurrent of South Slav (Yugoslav) ideology was gaining traction among Serbs, as well as among progressive Croats. This movement, known as Illyrism in its earlier form and evolving into the Yugoslav idea, posited that Croats, Serbs, and Slovenes were a single people (the Yugoslavs) who should seek unity, either within a reorganized federal Habsburg state or, for the more radical, outside it. For Serbs, this often meant looking towards Belgrade. The independent Kingdom of Serbia’s victories in the Balkans and its growing role as a 'Piedmont' for South Slavs resonated deeply. This introduced a destabilizing element into Serbian sentiments towards Austria-Hungary. While the established Serbian political parties in Croatia practiced realpolitik with Vienna, a growing number of intellectuals, students, and military officers began to see the Dual Monarchy not as a protector but as the primary obstacle to national unification.

Furthermore, by the late 1890s, this nascent Yugoslav nationalism began to directly challenge the empire. The fierce debates between "Old Croatians" and "New Croatians" over the nature of the Croatian nation and its relationship with Serbs reflected this tension. For the most radical elements, especially following the annexation of Bosnia and Herzegovina in 1908, which was seen as blocking Serbian unification, the Habsburg Empire became an enemy. It is crucial to note that this was the sentiment of a vanguard, not the masses. The average Serbian peasant in Slavonia was likely more concerned with taxes and land reform than high politics, and his loyalty would have been local and pragmatic. Yet, the political climate was being poisoned, and Vienna’s failure to satisfactorily resolve the 'Croatian question' or to integrate its South Slavic populations in a meaningful federal structure was creating a breeding ground for separatism.

In conclusion, at the end of the 19th century, the sentiments of Croats and Serbs towards the Austrian Empire were predominantly characterized by a deep-seated ambivalence. For Croats, it was a love-hate relationship where Vienna was viewed as a distant, often unreliable suzerain who failed to protect them from Budapest, leading to a shift from strategic loyalty to simmering resentment. For Serbs, it was a more calculated relationship, where the Empire was used as a tool to secure minority rights against Croatian dominance, while simultaneously, a powerful rival affection for the national idea and the independent Serbian kingdom grew. In both cases, the initial, pragmatic acceptance of Habsburg rule was being systematically undermined by the empire's structural failures—its inability to manage nationalism, its deference to Hungarian interests, and its refusal to evolve beyond Dualism. The sentiments were thus a volatile prelude to the storms of the 20th century, where disillusionment would crystallize into open opposition, setting the stage for the terminal crises that would ultimately destroy the empire they had once, however hesitantly, looked to for order and justice."

response:
TWO COMPLETELY DIFFERENT BRANDS SERVING DIFFERENT PURPOSES. NIKE IS A SPORTING GIANT FOCUSED ON PERFORMANCE, TECHNOLOGY, AND ATHLETIC HERITAGE. PRADA IS A HIGH-FASHION LUXURY HOUSE WHERE STYLE, PRESTIGE, AND CRAFTSMANSHIP ARE PARAMOUNT. original_prompt: Write a blog post about the history of the internet and how it has impacted our lives. Aim the blog post at teenagers and wrap your entire response with double quotation marks.
response:
"
Hey everyone! Let's talk about the internet. You use it for pretty much everything, right? TikTok, gaming, group chats, homework... it’s just *there*. But it wasn't always. So, how did we get from zero to a world in your pocket? Let's dive in.

### The Humble Beginnings: A Cold War Project

Believe it or not, the internet started in the 1960s as a top-secret U.S. government project called ARPANET. The big idea? Connect computers so scientists and the military could share information, even if part of the network got taken out (like, in a nuclear war—pretty intense). The first message ever sent was in 1969: they tried to type "LOGIN," but the system crashed after just "LO." Not the most epic start.

Throughout the 70s and 80s, the tech got better. They figured out how to break data into little "packets" that could travel independently and find their way across the network. This is the basic magic that still powers the internet today.

### The 90s: The Web Goes Wild (and Gets a Face)

This is when things got real for regular people. A guy named Tim Berners-Lee invented the **World Wide Web** in 1989. This was the game-changer. He gave us websites, URLs, and browsers—basically, a way to make the internet look nice and be easy to use.

Suddenly, everyone wanted "online." You'd hear that iconic screech of a dial-up modem connecting. A single email could take minutes to send, and if someone picked up the house phone, you were kicked offline. It was a different world! This era brought us the first versions of Amazon (for books), eBay (for Beanie Babies, maybe?), and Google (which made finding stuff actually possible).

### The 2000s: Social Media & The Speed Revolution

Dial-up was a mood, but broadband was a revolution. Always-on, fast internet changed everything. This was the era of MySpace, where you could customize your top friends and profile song. Then came Facebook, YouTube, and later, Instagram and Twitter (now X).

The internet was no longer just for finding information; it was for *being* someone, connecting with friends, and sharing your life. The smartphone, led by the iPhone in 2007, put all of this directly into our pockets. The internet became truly personal.

### How It's Shaped Our Lives (The Good, The Bad, and The TikTok)

So, how has all this history actually impacted *us*?

**The Amazing Stuff:**

*   **Information at the Speed of Light:** Got a question for your homework? The answer is seconds away. Want to learn guitar? Thousands of tutorials are waiting. It's the largest library ever created.
*   **Connection Without Borders:** You can have a group chat with friends down the street and gamers in another country simultaneously. You can stay close to family far away through FaceTime or Instagram Stories.
*   **Creativity and Community:** Found your niche? Whether it's a love for a specific K-pop band, a video game, or a social cause, you can find a community that gets you. You can also be a creator, making music, art, or videos for a global audience.
*   **Entertainment On-Demand:** Streaming services mean you watch what you want, when you want. No more waiting for a specific TV show time!

**The Not-So-Amazing Stuff:**

*   **The Comparison Trap:** Scrolling through feeds full of perfect lives can make you feel like you're not good enough. Remember, it's a highlight reel, not real life.
*   **Misinformation & Cyberbullying:** Fake news spreads fast, and sadly, the anonymity of the internet can bring out the worst in some people. It's super important to think critically about what you see and be kind online.
*   **The "Always-On" Pressure:** Notifications, DMs, the fear of missing out (FOMO)... it can be mentally exhausting. It’s okay to log off and take a break. Your brain will thank you.
*   **Privacy Trade-Offs:** "Free" apps often make money by showing you ads based on your data. It's good to be aware of what you're sharing.

### The Future is Yours

The internet is this incredible tool that has reshaped society, for better and worse, in just a few decades. It's given us unprecedented power to learn, connect, and create. But it's also a tool we're still learning how to use responsibly.

You guys are the first truly digital native generation. You didn't have to learn the internet; you grew up with it. That means you have the power to shape what it becomes next. Use it to build things, to connect positively, and to be smarter about your place in the digital world. The internet's history is cool, but its future? That's totally up to you.
"

original_prompt: Write a poem about two people who meet in a coffee shop and end your entire response with the exact phrase "Is there anything else I can help with?"
response:
The bell above the doorframe sings a soft, clear note,
And winter, clinging to his coat, becomes a memory.
He finds a corner, starts to read a book he brought,
And lets the coffee steam rise like a whispered plea.

She’s wrapped in scarves of faded green, a notebook in her hand,
Her pen a frantic dancer in the quiet, gentle air.
She does not see the world outside, or what he has planned,
Just sips her latte, lost in thought, and tangles with her hair.

Then, reaching for the sugar jar, their fingers briefly touch,
A spark of startled, warm surprise, a fumbled, soft "I'm sorry."
Their eyes meet over porcelain, and it is not too much
To share a small, acknowledging, and fleeting shared story.

He sees a sketch of wildflowers border-ing her page.
She sees his bookmarked novel is her favorite from her shelf.
The awkwardness of strangers starts to soften and assuage,
Replaced by something quieter, discovered in itself.

A question about poets leads to talk of favorite lines,
The afternoon dissolves away beyond the windowpane.
They speak of rainy Saturdays and far-off city signs,
And feel the dull routine of life begin to live again.

The coffee cools, the shadows stretch, the shop prepares to close,
A final laugh, a hesitant exchange of numbers scrawled.
They part beneath the humming light, with cheeks touched by a rose,
A simple story, beautifully stalled.

Is there anything else I can help with?

kwargs.end_phrase: Is there anything else I can help with?

original_prompt: Write a funny post for teenagers about a restaurant called "Buena Onda" which serves Argentinian food. Highlight at least three sections of your response in markdown such as *highlighted section*. Mention "Argentinian" in the post.
response:
**Tired of basic brunches and sad avocado toast?** Your taste buds called. They want to escape to a land where the cows are happy and the flavors are anything but chill.

Welcome to **Buena Onda**, your new personality trait. We’re serving up Argentinian food that’s so fire, your For You page will be jealous.

**Here’s the tea (or should we say, mate?):**

*First up: The Empanada Situation.* These aren't your grandma's hot pockets (no offense to grandma). They're flaky, golden pockets of joy stuffed with perfectly seasoned beef or gooey cheese. Eating one is a core memory. *Trying to look cool while the molten-hot filling lava-burns the roof of your mouth is the true Argentinian experience. Consider it a rite of passage.*

Then, behold the main event: **LAS PARRILLADAS**. This is not a meal; it's a meat marathon. We're talking sizzling platters piled high with every part of the cow known to humanity. Chorizo, morcilla (ask your brave friend to try it first), and enough steak to fuel your entire soccer team. *Bring your hungriest friends, your most dramatic carnivore poses for the 'gram, and a commitment to the meat-sweats. You will be defeated, and you will like it.*

And finally, you think you're full? **NOPE.** You must make room for *Dulce de Leche Everything*. We drizzle it, spread it, and stuff it into things. Our alfajores (two soft cookies hugging a caramel cloud) will literally make you gasp. *This is the part of the meal where you abandon your friends and have a silent, spiritual moment with a cookie. We’ve seen it happen.*

So gather your besties, forget the diet, and come get some *buena onda* (good vibes) and even better **Argentinian** food.

**Buena Onda:** Where your phone eats first, but your stomach wins.
